event_description:
Get ready for an unforgettable afternoon of music united by a shared commitment to innovation and artistic expression! 

Join us for an extraordinary concert featuring the iconic sounds of The Beatles and the timeless compositions of Beethoven. 

Experience the magic of The Fab Four’s revolutionary rock hits, reimagined alongside the majestic power of Beethoven’s masterpieces. Whether you’re a fan of the classic harmonies of the Beatles or the dramatic brilliance of Beethoven, this concert brings together two musical worlds in a stunning fusion that will captivate your senses. 

Don’t miss out on this one-of-a-kind event that celebrates the genius of these legendary artists, where past and present collide in perfect harmony. Featuring guest artists Jonathan Crow, Hezekiah Leung and Neil Deland.
short_description: Get ready for an unforgettable afternoon of music united by a shared commitment to innovation and artistic expression!

cost_notes: Early bird pricing is available until September 8, 2025. Register early and save using the registration link.
event_description:
Part of our ASPIRE Project (Addressing Barriers to Employment for Muslim Women), this conference aims at fostering equitable and inclusive work environments for Canadian Muslim women. 

The event is a unique learning and sharing experience for Canadian employers, Muslim, racialized women, community-based researchers, employment activists, community settlement workers and policy makers. It includes plenary sessions, concurrent workshops, panel discussions, skills-building and networking opportunities.

Our keynote speakers and expert-led sessions will cover transformative topics including, affirming the case for EDI in the face of backlash, employment and human rights law, inclusive leadership amd much more! Our impressive lineup include: Dr. Wendy Cukier, Muneeza Sheikh, Dr. Zainab Abdurrahman, Dr. Golnaz Golnaraghi and Dr. Rhonda McEwen.
event_name: I Belong, You Belong: CCMW's National Employment Conference
short_description: Part of our ASPIRE Project (Addressing Barriers to Employment for Muslim Women), this conference aims at fostering equit
short_name: I Belong, You Belong: CCMW's National Employment Conference

This is a beginner-friendly hike. Binoculars available to borrow.

For participants ages 16 and up.

event_description:
The most talked about play of the decade.

Sharp, provocative, and wildly entertaining theatrical sensation that has sparked conversations from Broadway to London. Now making its Canadian premiere, this electrifying play by Jeremy O. Harris turns up the heat on love, race, and relationships in ways that are bold, unexpected, and impossible to forget.  

A daring, seductive, and razor-sharp satire, audiences will be on a journey where pleasure and history meet, flipping assumptions and igniting sparks along the way. It’s a show that’s as playfully cheeky as it is thought-provoking, designed to make you feel, think, and maybe even blush.

event_description:
You are invited into the beating heart of contemporary craft and design, a space where tradition meets bold reinvention, and where the maker’s hand is ever-present. 

Through the exceptional work of our current Artists-in-Residence, this exhibition explores the enduring relevance of skilled making in a world dominated by speed, automation and disposability. 

We are a cornerstone of Canada’s craft landscape, a rare incubator where artists have the time, space and support to experiment, collaborate and grow their professional careers. From glass, metal and ceramics to textiles and contemporary design, the residents featured here are not only shaping objects – they are shaping culture.  

In this context, to “meet your maker” is to engage with the processes, politics and poetics of craft and design today. It’s a chance to stand face to face with emerging visionaries who transform raw mate
short_description: You are invited into the beating heart of contemporary craft and design, a space where tradition meets bold reinvention,

A quiet lake in Ontario is making a lot of noise.

Sediments from the bottom of a small lake in Ontario are revealing a remarkable record of our impact on the planet.

Just outside Toronto, Ontario lies Crawford Lake, a significant site offering a unique, comprehensive 1,000-year record of human impacts - local, regional, and global.

event_description:
Step into an immersive visual experience where material becomes memory, and memory becomes art. 

A compelling mixed media art exhibition that explores emotion, expression, and the sense of belonging through abstract and landscape works. From fragmented shorelines to colour-washed horizons and textured echoes of time, the exhibition invites viewers into a space of contemplation and connection, where personal and collective memories surface through layered materials and imaginative forms.

Step into the glow, we're back for the sixth year! 

This year, guests can explore the magic like never before with a brand-new layout that lets you move freely between the immersive light show and Pumpkinville at your own pace. Wander through the illuminated maze of over 1.5 million LED and RGB lights, then pop into a vibrant fall fair featuring all new glowing photo ops, installations, midway rides, carnival games, and over 15,000 pumpkins. With new scenes, dazzling photo moments, and an entirely transformed setup, this is not just a walk, it's an adventure!

event_description:
Discover how homes shape identity through the Austin family story and contemporary art at Spadina Museum. Reimagine history, reframe home.

“Home at Spadina Museum” considers how people are influenced by their home. We look at those who make it a home and those who live in it are shaped by domestic spaces. Through interpretation of the Austin family and into contemporary art, we will analyze what makes a home. Re-Imagining the Historic House Museum: A Workplace for Women. 

Step into “Home at Spadina Museum” and explore how homes are shaped by the people who live and work in them. From the Austin family to contemporary art, discover untold stories of women’s labour, care, and community. Reimagine the historic house as both a home and a workplace.

As you explore the exhibition, we invite you to reflect: "What does home mean to you?"

We are grateful to our community partners, Augusto Bitter and the Women’s Art Association of Canada.
event_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Home at Spadina Museum
short_description: Discover how homes shape identity through the Austin family story and contemporary art at Spadina Museum. Reimagine hist
short_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Home at Spadina Museum

event_description:
Sharks have intrigued humans for as long as we have explored the oceans. The terrifying monster from the movie Jaws is what many might imagine when they think of these animals, but they are far more fascinating and complex than their depiction in popular culture.

This exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research, and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

event_description:
Two internationally acclaimed  experiences, SÉANCE and FLIGHT, are coming. 

Staged inside purpose-built 40-foot shipping containers, these genre-defying works use complete darkness, 360° binaural audio, and precisely timed physical and environmental effects to create psychologically charged alternate realities.

The Toronto season brings two of the company’s most toured experiences to Canada for the first time. With over 700,000 attendees worldwide and appearances of their work at Venice Film Festival, Tribeca, SXSW, and Edinburgh Fringe, Toronto is now invited also to step inside the dark.

event_description:
One of Toronto's oldest holiday traditions. 

First staged here in 1938, this pageant began in St. Martin-in-the-Fields church in London, England in 1928. Queen Elizabeth and her sister Margaret were taken to see it when they were little girls. The story of the Nativity is told through a series of narrated scenes linked by beautiful organ music and carols from an unseen choir.   

Close to 50 volunteers, including babies who take turns playing the role of baby Jesus, perform in the cast. The Church of the Holy Trinity, a 178-year-old architectural treasure, brings its own charm to the show.  ASL interpretation is available on Friday, December 19th.
short_description:
One of Toronto's oldest holiday traditions. 

First staged here in 1938, this pageant began in St. Martin-in-the-Fields

event_description:
Since 1975, we have been Canada’s favourite holiday tradition, spotlighting the creativity and talent of makers from across the country. This year, we proudly celebrate our 50th anniversary, honouring 
five decades of Canadian craft while looking ahead to an exciting new era.

More than just a marketplace, this is a cultural movement where creativity comes to life. Visitors can shop from over 700 artisans and makers, discover one-of-a-kind treasures and support Canadian small businesses, all while experiencing the festive magic of the season.

This year enjoy a brand-new vintage section, full of nostalgic finds, a European-style Christmas Market with festive gifts, décor, food and drink, an expanded Flavours section for food lovers and special Northwest Territories Pop-Up.
event_name: One Of a Kind Christmas Show | 50th Anniversary

event_description:
Witness the exceptional talents of RCM alumni Luka Coetzee and Jon Kimura Parker as they perform a delightful program including Omar Daniel: Duo for Violoncello and Piano, Johannes Brahms: Cello Sonata No. 2 in F Major, op. 99, George Gershwin: Three Preludes, and Sergei Rachmaninov: Cello Sonata in G Minor, op. 19.

event_description: Join us for a spine-chilling paranormal adventure where intimate groups of 12 or fewer will have exclusive access to investigate haunted heritage buildings – including the notorious Half Way House – in the dark! Feel the chill of the night and listen to the whispers of the past as we employ ancient and modern techniques to attempt to establish contact with the lingering spirits that call the Village home. ‘Alone in the Dark’ is as real as it gets, nothing is hidden or staged. This unforgettably eerie evening will delight ghost story enthusiasts, fearless paranormal investigators, history aficionados, urban explorers, and anyone with a curiosity about the unknown. Book your spot now—spaces fill fast! All participants must be 16 or older.

event_description:
Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and perspectives forming a kind of visual and sonic cacophony. It’s a nod to global (or even galactic) unity, and to the idea that despite all the noise and division, we’re more alike than not. 

In her Canadian debut, Intergalactic Planetary brings together imagery and works inspired by cities including Shanghai, Chongqing, Berlin, Tokyo, Bangkok and locations across the United States. Snelling explains, “Through this work, I ask: how can we move beyond our fears, borders, and egos to become more humane? Perhaps by staying curious, open, and willing to see each other more fully, we can take a small step toward connection, and even a glimmer of peace for the future”.

Join us on Nuit Blanche to view the exhibition's works, while DJ beats set the mood with dynamic sounds and enjoy two exhibition-inspired cocktails-one coffee-based and the other with an intergalactic twist.
short_description: Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and p

event_description:
Celebrating our 40th anniversary with the return of Mozart’s enchanting fairy tale!

One of the most popular productions in our repetoire and sung in Andrew Porter’s acclaimed English translation, The Magic Flute is a dazzling blend of comedy and fantasy, in which dragons and spirits roam, and perseverance is rewarded by true love. This is the tale of a prince, Tamino, who is sent by the Queen of the Night to rescue her daughter Pamina from her nemesis Sarastro.

event_description:
Since 1975, we have been Canada’s favourite holiday tradition, spotlighting the creativity and talent of makers from across the country. This year, we proudly celebrate our 50th anniversary, honouring 
five decades of Canadian craft while looking ahead to an exciting new era.

More than just a marketplace, this is a cultural movement where creativity comes to life. Visitors can shop from over 700 artisans and makers, discover one-of-a-kind treasures and support Canadian small businesses, all while experiencing the festive magic of the season.

This year enjoy a brand-new vintage section, full of nostalgic finds, a European-style Christmas Market with festive gifts, décor, food and drink, an expanded Flavours section for food lovers and special Northwest Territories Pop-Up.
event_name: One Of a Kind Christmas Show | 50th Anniversary

short_name: One Of a Kind Christmas Show | 50th Anniversary

event_description:
Tricks or Treats? We've got both!

Join us for our annual Mall-O-Ween event featuring Trick-or-Treating and a Mystifying Magic Show you won't want to miss!

Little ghouls and goblins can pick up a free Halloween Passport from our Pumpkin Passport Station, located in center court, and visit participating stores to collect spooky stamps and creepy coupons. Once you collect all stamps return to the pumpkin passport station to redeem for a special gift.

Come for the treats, stay for the tricks. Get your costumes ready and join us - we can't wait to see you!

Tricks or Treats? We've got both!

Join us for our annual Mall-O-Ween event featuring Trick-or-Treating and a Mystifying

event_description:
Established its pre-eminence among the world’s finest string quartets with its impeccable musicianship, sophisticated artistry, and, above all, an unmatched ability to play as one. Their performances are characterized by a rare musical spontaneity, giving audiences the sense of hearing even treasured canon repertoire as if for the first time. 

Described by the Washington Post as "...one of the best quartets before the public today", enjoy a delightful program of Alfred Schnittke: String Quartet No. 2, Jonny Greenwood: Suite from the film "There Will Be Blood", and Maurice Ravel: String Quartet in F Major.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.

These distinguished members actively teach, exhibit their work, sustain their artistic practices and generously volunteer their time. Representing diverse disciplines, including painting, sculpture, printmaking and photography, the Life Members embody the creative spirit and dedication that enrich the arts.

event_description:
Hear chilling and eerie tales on a lantern tour of Fort York and its historic surroundings. Learn about a haunted lighthouse and the bloody Battle of York. Explore the military burial ground. Tour the creepy shadows and 200-year-old buildings of Fort York at night and learn of the fort’s history and its many paranormal mysteries.

Recommended for ages 12 and up. Youth 12 to 16 must be accompanied by an adult. 

Part of the tour takes place outside, so please dress for the weather. The tour includes walking outside and in the dark, and crossing busy streets.
This program requires accessibility of stairs and uneven ground.
event_name: Fort York After Dark: Lantern Tours

It’s magical intimate setting,  offers the perfect blend of dinner, handcrafted cocktails, and smooth rhythms. Whether you’re here to unwind, connect, or be inspired, it’s more than a night out—it’s a vibe. Join us weekly for music, magic, and memorable moments.

event_description:
Join JUNO Award-winning singer-songwriter Sammy Jackson for an intimate evening celebrating her new album "In the Meantime". 

With two EPs, a full-length album, and a 2021 JUNO win for Vocal Jazz Album of the Year, Jamaican-Canadian singer-songwriter Sammy Jackson has quickly become one of the most exciting young musicians on the Canadian music scene. 

Jackson has performed on some of Canada's premier stages, including the Festival International de Jazz de Montréal, the Toronto Jazz Festival, Koerner Hall, Flato Markham Theatre, and Westben. 

With her beautiful tone and a strong understanding of musical tradition, Jackson is a confident, subtle singer who has developed a unique sound, both as a vocalist and as a composer, melding jazz, R&B, pop, and other influences into a style all her own.

event_description:
Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legendary outlaw tale takes on a bold twist - our Robin is a spirited, savvy heroine leading her merry band of misfits in a fight for justice and kindness.  

Join Robin and her friends on a medieval romp through merry old Torontoshire! Journey through the lush forests of High Park, go head-to-head with the greedy Prince John, and rescue those in need - all with a hearty dose of laughter, pop hits, and plenty of surprises. 

Robin Hood delivers all the Panto fun you love, a sparkling spoof on a classic tale, hilarious comedy, dazzling musical numbers, and an intergenerational celebration that's perfect for the whole family.  

Grab your loved ones, don your green tights, and join us for a experience full of mischief, melody, and meaning.
event_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

Join us at Canada’s premier coin and banknote show and auction!

Featuring over 50 internationally renowned coin and banknote dealers, representing Canada, United States, and the world of collectable currencies. This is the place to buy, sell, and appraise your coins, banknotes, tokens, medals, militaria, gold and silver. You are sure to find a one-of-a-kind coin or banknote treasures!

Furthermore, enjoy fun workshops for children and collectors.

event_description: Join us as we explore the supernatural side of Toronto’s historic and haunted pioneer village Featuring some of the oldest buildings in the city it is the perfect creepy backdrop for a night of spine-tingling ghost stories. Many of which have occurred to previous village guests and Haunted Walk tour guides. It is easily one of the most active sites we tour and is a must-do for paranormal enthusiasts. Not recommended for children or easily frightened adults.

event_description:
Isabel Bayrakdarian is renowned across opera houses and concert halls the world over for her strikingly multihued voice, presence, and style. 

She has been applauded for opera performances in Chicago, Dresden, London, Milan, New York, Paris, Salzburg, San Francisco, and Toronto, and is celebrated as well for her work in remoter operas of the repertory, such as Berlioz's Benvenuto Cellini and Bolcom's A View from the Bridge, in which she made her Metropolitan Opera debut.

She has sung on the Grammy Award-winning soundtrack of the blockbuster film The Lord of The Rings: The Two Towers, and her voice can also be heard in Atom Egoyan’s multiple award-winning Canadian film Ararat.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
event_name: Isabel Bayrakdarian with Kevork Mourad: Ancestral Songs, Prayers, and Lullabies

event_description:
Acclaimed by the New York Times as “a founding father of a genre that fuses performance art, music and stand-up comedy.” 

Actor, host, writer, designer, and producer, the inimitable Isaac Mizrahi brings his signature blend of storytelling, song, and sharp-witted humour to Toronto. A name synonymous with high fashion, Mizrahi brings glitz, glam, and runway magic straight to the cabaret, showcasing his talents as a glamorous chanteur extraordinaire. 

Hailed by The New York Times as “determined to challenge the cultural status quo,” Mizrahi is as bold and brilliant as ever. Whether you are a devoted fan or discovering his artistry for the first time, this is an evening not to be missed.
short_description: Acclaimed by the New York Times as “a founding father of a genre that fuses performance art, music and stand-up comedy.”

event_description:
Choreographed by Daniel Léveillé.

Four bodies surrendered to dance revealing what nestles beneath strangely opaque skin: muscle, water, breath, energy, a way of being that is so intensely alive and attuned to others, in spite of or because of, the need not to be entirely alone. 

It speaks of solitude, but more so of the infinite tenderness of touch, the harshness of life, and the yearning for elevation or escape from these bodies, often so heavy. Offering nudity as frank and free of false modesty, the skin is the body’s one true costume.
short_description:
Choreographed by Daniel Léveillé.

Four bodies surrendered to dance revealing what nestles beneath strangely opaque skin

Get ready to laugh and be amazed as talented improvisers bring the works of Shakespeare to life in a whole new way! No scripts, just pure creativity and wit as they create worlds on the spot inspired by the Bard's famous plays. Whether you're a Shakespeare aficionado or just looking for a fun night out, this event is sure to entertain!

Breaking Bard is:
Emma Grabinsky, Ryan Sheedy, Maria Besko, Frank Nicolson, Janek Gonsalkorale, Tim Mikula

event_description:
The multiple Grammy Award nominated ensemble performs works by Frederick Block, Jerzy Fitelberg, Arthur Willner in a program to be performed later in New York.

Composed of the senior faculty of The Royal Conservatory's Glenn Gould School, with special guests drawn from the organization's most accomplished students and alumni, the ARC Ensemble is one of Canada's most distinguished cultural ambassadors. The research and recovery of works suppressed and marginalized under the 20th century's repressive regimes remains its focus, a growing number of which have now rejoined the repertoire.

“As always with this ensemble, performances could hardly be bettered in terms of execution and commitment.” - Gramophone.
short_description: The multiple Grammy Award nominated ensemble performs works by Frederick Block, Jerzy Fitelberg, Arthur Willner in a pro

event_description:
This is a contemporary form of environmental art created by artists who are  concerned about reducing waste, recycling, and making the world a better place, while raising awareness about environmental changes.

 It aims to showcases the beauty and creativity of using recycled, environmentally friendly or sustainable materials to create phenomenal artwork, using water-based paints, natural pigments and recycled materials to name a few elements. lt is art that advocates for the planet, catering to all ages and present in various mediums, including paintings, sculptures or fashion.

Presenting our second annual art exhibition, we will be utilizing selected artists to mentor African and Caribbean communities on the positioning of multicultural history and art within the Canadian cultural landscape.
short_description: This is a contemporary form of environmental art created by artists who are  concerned about reducing waste, recycling,

event_description:
Explore the timeless interiors of Old City Hall and marvel at the grand staircase, stunning murals, and the historic former City Council Chamber — each space a witness to Toronto’s past. Enjoy its Romanesque Revival architecture, historic courtrooms and intricate iron finishings. Completed in 1899 and designed by architect E.J. Lennox, the building served as the city's municipal hub for more than 60 years.

Click on the event website link under contact information to access an audio tour.

event_description:
This Halloween, Montgomery's Inn invites visitors after dark to uncover eerie tales about the past inhabitants of the Inn and the Old Town of Islington. Visitors will explore the historic house and the Islington burying grounds, learn about Victorian death practices, and find new ways to connect with Toronto's past.

This guided tour of the historic house will be followed by a walking tour of the nearby Islington Burying grounds. Following the walking tour, guests will return to the historic house for refreshments by the fire.

Trigger warning: topics such as illness, death and other difficult topics will be discussed during this event.

This program is for ages 12 and up. Youth 12-16 years of age much be accompanied by an adult ticketholder.

Non-resident surcharge will not apply.

TICKETS ARE NON-REFUNDABLE.

event_description:
The Grammy Award-nominated English a-cappella octet returns for another extraordinary Christmas concert.

Touring globally, VOCES8 performs an extensive repertory both in its a cappella concerts and in collaborations with leading musicians, orchestras, conductors, and soloists. Versatility and a celebration of diverse musical expression are central to the ensemble’s performance and education ethos which is shared both online and in person.

The Arts Desk proclaims “VOCES8 are the Rolls-Royce of British a cappella ensembles”.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
short_description:
The Grammy Award-nominated English a-cappella octet returns for another extraordinary Christmas concert.

Touring global

event_description:
Koffler Arts presents the second World Play event, curated by Alon Nashman, on the theme of "Borders".

More than a literary showcase, World Play is an immersive journey into phonaesthetics, the beauty and resonance of language as sound. 

Each event invites audiences to experience a rich tapestry of voices through brief readings of poetry, theatre, fiction, philosophy, and song lyrics, all performed in multiple languages and translated into English.
event_name: World Play: Reading Toronto's Many Languages
short_description:
Koffler Arts presents the second World Play event, curated by Alon Nashman, on the theme of "Borders".

More than a lite
short_name: World Play: Reading Toronto's Many Languages

event_description:
I'm With Her is a band rooted in a rare alchemy - three celebrated songwriters coming together to create music that reveals entirely new possibilities in their distinct and deep-seated talents. Since forming, Sarah Jarosz, Aoife O'Donovan, and Sara Watkins have imbued their songs with a sharply detailed lyricism, graceful musicianship, and mesmerizing harmonies that endlessly reflect their extraordinary chemistry.

Led by Dublin-based brothers Diarmuid and Brían Mac Gloinn, Irish alt-folk group Ye Vagabonds has been described as “being at the fore of a new wave of Irish folk.” They have toured relentlessly in recent years across Ireland, the UK, Europe, and beyond including (alongside their own headline touring) notable Special Guest slots opening for the likes of Patti Smith, Hozier, Phoebe Bridgers, boygenuius, Dermot Kennedy, and Vampire Weekend.
event_name: I’m With Her and Special Guest Ye Vagabonds
short_description: I'm With Her is a band rooted in a rare alchemy - three celebrated songwriters coming together to create music that reve
short_name: I’m With Her and Special Guest Ye Vagabonds

event_description:
An adventure into the Age of Uncertanity. 

These images definitely pose more questions than providing answers. Join in on a journey that neurotically pokes at the stresses of climate change. Feel the relentless pressure of time ticking away.
Might be fun? Or not!

Four parts to this adventure. First, "Invasive Species" - creatures that are motivated by a human-altered climate to move. Followed by "My Resilient Garden" - hope, maybe not for humans, but for the rest of the world to carry on. Next up, "The Human Factor" - we started this upheaval and we are now the victims. Can we do anything but squirm? Let’s hope. Ending with "It’s About Time" a playful reminder that time is running out.
event_name: then, there's this... by David McClyment
short_description:
An adventure into the Age of Uncertanity. 

These images definitely pose more questions than providing answers. Join in
short_name: then, there's this... by David McClyment

event_description:
Hear chilling and eerie tales on a lantern tour of Fort York and its historic surroundings. Learn about a haunted lighthouse and the bloody Battle of York. Explore the military burial ground. Tour the creepy shadows and 200-year-old buildings of Fort York at night and learn of the fort’s history and its many paranormal mysteries.

Recommended for ages 12 and up. Youth 12 to 16 must be accompanied by an adult. 

Part of the tour takes place outside, so please dress for the weather. The tour includes walking outside and in the dark, and crossing busy streets.
This program requires accessibility of stairs and uneven ground.
event_name: Fort York After Dark: Lantern Tours

event_description:
Borders divide, the cosmos unites.

Canadian legend Robert Lepage returns to Canadian Stage after sold-out productions of 887 and Needles and Opium.

Set against the Cold War's fierce U.S.-Soviet rivalry, this gripping story explores the personal and political turmoil of an era defined by global tension with a uniquely Canadian perspective. Through the tale of two Quebec City brothers, Lepage's stunning use of multimedia and visual storytelling draws the audience into a world on the brink of change and portrays the impact of global conflict on the individual.
event_name: The Far Side of the Moon
short_description:
Borders divide, the cosmos unites.

Canadian legend Robert Lepage returns to Canadian Stage after sold-out productions o
short_name: The Far Side of the Moon

event_description:
The City of Toronto has successfully restored and enhanced important wetland habitat and created an upgraded southern trailhead for the Crothers Woods trail network. 

Located at Pottery Road and Bayview Avenue, at the southern tip of the Crothers Woods Environmentally Significant Area, the site features extensive native tree, shrub and aquatic plantings, new trail connections, enhanced wayfinding, and two new lookouts for visitors to enjoy. This project helps to improve our ravine ecosystems, trail connectivity, user safety and experience.

Funding for this project was provided by Canada’s Investing in Canada Infrastructure Program (ICIP) and the Hydro One Biodiversity Initiative and delivered in collaboration with the Toronto & Region Conservation Authority (TRCA).

Date: Monday, October 6, 2025 
Arrival time: 9:45 a.m.
Event time: 10:00 a.m. 
Location: Cudmore Creek Wetland & Trailhead (Pottery Rd & Bayview Ave Intersection
Parking:  5-minute walk away, at Todmorden Mills
event_name: Cudmore Creek Wetland & Trailhead: Opening Ceremony
short_description: The City of Toronto has successfully restored and enhanced important wetland habitat and created an upgraded southern tr
short_name: Cudmore Creek Wetland & Trailhead: Opening Ceremony

event_description:
A vibrant, Toronto-based community-focused event that goes beyond entertainment. By blending independent and impactful films, educational outreach, awards, and interactive experiences, it acts as a bridge for cultural exchange, social exploration, and community empowerment.

The festival’s core mission is to advance education and raise cultural, artistic, and aesthetic awareness within the community. It aims to enrich public appreciation for the arts through film programming, workshops, and panel discussions, while uplifting both filmmakers and artists.

event_description:
Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legendary outlaw tale takes on a bold twist - our Robin is a spirited, savvy heroine leading her merry band of misfits in a fight for justice and kindness.  

Join Robin and her friends on a medieval romp through merry old Torontoshire! Journey through the lush forests of High Park, go head-to-head with the greedy Prince John, and rescue those in need - all with a hearty dose of laughter, pop hits, and plenty of surprises. 

Robin Hood delivers all the Panto fun you love, a sparkling spoof on a classic tale, hilarious comedy, dazzling musical numbers, and an intergenerational celebration that's perfect for the whole family.  

Grab your loved ones, don your green tights, and join us for a experience full of mischief, melody, and meaning.
event_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

event_description:
Join our Storytelling Circle at Montgomery's Inn! 

This Storytelling Circle is a welcoming and relaxing environment designed to make everyone feel safe to share our stories. Participants will gather in a circle to listen to the stories from different oral traditions, as well as share their favourite stories! 

Participants will be guided by our principal storyteller Maria Ordonez, who will invite them to share, create, improvise and retell their own stories. Stories will change according to monthly themes - so there will always be new stories to hear and share! 

This program also takes place during Montgomery's Inn's weekly Farmer's Market.
short_description:
Join our Storytelling Circle at Montgomery's Inn! 

This Storytelling Circle is a welcoming and relaxing environment des

event_description:
We’re presenting another all-night art experience to our East Toronto communities!

With a focus on different languages, cultures, stories and ideas of the neighbourhood not yet explored or platformed. You are invited to join us and enjoy the return of our IN VIEW series, an impressive storefront gallery exhibition; stop into an all-night forest-themed Silent Disco in collaboration with Native Women in the Arts.

event_description:
Join Scarborough Museum for a Season of Celebration! Embrace the spirit of light, love, and joy through a series of family-friendly activities centered on food, culture, and storytelling.  

Enjoy gingerbread decorating, family-friendly winter crafts and weekly workshops led by guest facilitators, including chair yoga, henna and more! See additional listings for more details. 

Community Feature: Sample a rotating selection of warm drinks and finger foods from around the world, curated by the Scarborough Museum Youth Collective and participants of Scarborough Museum’s Newcomer Storytelling Circles. Try something new or enjoy an old favourite, learn more about the stories behind these sips and bites, and share your own stories of light and warmth in our community jar!  

Treats will be available first come-first served, while quantities last.
event_name: Season of Celebration at Scarborough Museum
short_description: Join Scarborough Museum for a Season of Celebration! Embrace the spirit of light, love, and joy through a series of fami
short_name: Season of Celebration at Scarborough Museum

event_description:
This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

Through dozens of interactives and life-sized models, including a life-size head of the huge extinct Megalodon, join us for a unique look at these magnificent creatures, their habitats, hunting techniques, and the conservation threats that they face.
short_description: This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding di

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands — better known today as Flanders — was home to revolutionary artists. These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then - and to our world today. 

This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects — medieval, Renaissance, and baroque paintings, sculptures and more — offers a doorway into the Southern Netherlands of 1400 to 1700. The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks

short_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Mast

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands — better known today as Flanders — was home to revolutionary artists. These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then - and to our world today. 

This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects — medieval, Renaissance, and baroque paintings, sculptures and more — offers a doorway into the Southern Netherlands of 1400 to 1700. The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks

event_description:
This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

Through dozens of interactives and life-sized models, including a life-size head of the huge extinct Megalodon, join us for a unique look at these magnificent creatures, their habitats, hunting techniques, and the conservation threats that they face.

Step into the world of teas with a guided connoisseur-led tasting of classic, herbal, and signature tea blends. Enjoy chef-inspired food pairings, bite size snacks and delicacies while sipping the teas
Learn the art of making Chai Latte with spices like cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, clove & pepper. Create 3 Seasonal Special Lattes and make yourself a Holiday Tea Cocktail
Connect with a community of tea lovers over flavor, culture & wellness and take home a Chai Mati holiday souvenir and exclusive recipe card.

Each ticket Includes:
- Admission for 1 guest
- Guided tasting of 6 unique tea blends
- Authentic chai-making demonstration & storytelling session 
- Seasonal special DIY latte & cocktail workshop
- Bite sized pairings, delicacies and snacks
- 1 Holiday Gift Souvenir Cup + exclusive recipe card
- VIP's get Front table seats + 1 Majestic Tea Tin w/ 13 assorted tea flavors + 1 stainless steel tea pot and 2 souvenir cups

event_description:
Step back in time with a free visit to Spadina Museum, beautifully decorated for a 1920s Christmas. Visitors can enjoy the opulent holiday décor and period ambiance that once filled the home of the wealthy Austin family. Twinkling lights, antique ornaments, and rooms set for a classic Jazz Age celebration bring the spirit of the season to life.
As you stroll through the mansion, interpretive displays offer insights into the lavish holiday traditions of Toronto’s elite in the 1920s. In contrast, visitors will also learn about the experiences of the city’s less fortunate citizens during the same era—those who faced poverty, unemployment, and food insecurity during a time of great social and economic change.
From a grand dining room prepared for a festive feast to modest depictions of how the servants of the household marked the holidays, the experience paints a full picture of a Toronto Christmas in the early 20th century.
event_name: Jazz Age Christmas at Spadina Museum

short_name: Jazz Age Christmas at Spadina Museum

event_description:
Renowned conductor Franz Welser-Möst, celebrated worldwide for leading the Vienna Philharmonic’s iconic New Year’s Concert, takes the podium for this unforgettable program. 

Spotlight Artist Bruce Liu brings Mozart’s spirited Piano Concerto No. 23 to vibrant life, and Richard Strauss’ radiant Der Rosenkavalier, a bittersweet tale of love and loss, warms hearts with its enchanting waltzes and tender melodies.

event_description:
The world-renowned virtuoso pays homage to some of the greatest trumpet players in history including Herb Alpert, Doc Severinsen, Louis Armstrong, Miles Davis, Chuck Mangione, and Chet Baker, accompanied by Robi Botos, Mike Downes, Kristian Alexandrov, and a string ensemble.

Heralded internationally as an outstanding artist, critics from the New York Times and Los Angeles Times have stated: “He played with golden timbre and virtuosic flair” and he is “a world-class talent”.

After the concert, enjoy a beverage and more music!
event_name: Jens Lindemann: Tribute to the Trumpet Greats

short_name: Jens Lindemann: Tribute to the Trumpet Greats

event_description:
Enjoy a series of celebrations in honour of this Canadian legend's centennial birthday.

Celebration starts with a nod to Peterson’s 1977 release, Oscar and the Bassists, featuring Christian McBride, John Clayton, and others, with Benny Green on piano, and Jeff Hamilton on drums, along with a performance of his AFRICA! Suite featuring the Clayton-Hamilton Jazz Orchestra, Green, and McBride, and hosted by The Honourable Justice Rosalie Abella. 

Hear Oscar’s solo compositions played by an all-star lineup of pianists: Makoto Ozone, Jon Kimura Parker, and Thompson Egbo-Egbo. Tune in to renowned jazz vocalist Cécile McLorin Salvant and her trio perform Oscar’s song.

Partake in masterclasses, talks, and performances by students from the RCM’s Oscar Peterson School of Music. 

Curated by Kelly Peterson and Mervon Mehta.

Enjoy a series of celebrations in honour of this Canadian legend's centennial birthday.

event_description:
Hear chilling and eerie tales on a lantern tour of Fort York and its historic surroundings. Learn about a haunted lighthouse and the bloody Battle of York. Explore the military burial ground. Tour the creepy shadows and 200-year-old buildings of Fort York at night and learn of the fort’s history and its many paranormal mysteries.

Recommended for ages 12 and up. Youth 12 to 16 must be accompanied by an adult. 

Part of the tour takes place outside, so please dress for the weather. The tour includes walking outside and in the dark, and crossing busy streets.
This program requires accessibility of stairs and uneven ground.
event_name: Fort York After Dark: Lantern Tours

event_description:
We are pleased to bring you the fifth annual Greek International Film Festival Tour of Canada (GIFFT).

This is a Canadian national film festival that will take place in 11 Canadian cities simultaneously. Those cities include: Toronto, Vancouver, Edmonton, Calgary, Regina, Winnipeg, London (Ontario), Hamilton/Niagara, Ottawa, and Halifax.

GIFFT is a showcase and celebration of Greek cinema and filmmakers of Greek Heritage. This festival will provide exciting platform for directors, writers, producers, and actors of Greek Heritage to showcase their exceptional art across Canada.

event_description:
Unlock the secrets to making these delightful French pastries. 

In this class you will learn how to prepare choux pastry and identify the key steps in perfecting your mixture, the technique used to perfectly pipe profiteroles, éclairs, and a demonstration of the Paris Brest. You will be shown the ideal baking technique to ensure your choux has the best texture, how to prepare the perfect pastry cream, how to fill your choux pastry, and the secret to preparing a glossy chocolate ganache.

A quiet lake in Ontario is making a lot of noise.

Sediments from the bottom of a small lake in Ontario are revealing a remarkable record of our impact on the planet.

Just outside Toronto, Ontario lies Crawford Lake, a significant site offering a unique, comprehensive 1,000-year record of human impacts - local, regional, and global.

event_description:
Welcoming audiences into an energetic visions of stories where memory, resistance, and imagination intertwine. 

This year’s line-up follows the rhythms of identity, from the pulsing beats of Afro-Antillean music to the quiet landscapes of childhood wonder to journeys across mountains, cities, and deserts in search of home and the intimate crossings of generations, friendships and dreams. 

In these films, rupture gives way to transformation, and every frame holds the promise of renewal. We honour voices that refuse to be silenced, visions that reshape reality, and connections that reach across borders. 

This is both a celebration and a reflection, a space where stories become bridges, and where watching together creates imagination and opens innovation.
event_name: aluCine Latin Film and Media Arts Festival Toronto

event_description:
Rural England, 1759. Halley’s Comet burns in the sky, and a young woman is sentenced to hang. But when she tries to escape the noose by claiming to be pregnant, a jury of twelve women are gathered to decide whether she is telling the truth. As tensions rise, their task becomes a reckoning: with the law, with power, and with the roles they’re forced to play in a world that silences them.

Tony-Award Nominee Lucy Kirkwood’s The Welkin (Chimerica, The Children) is a bold and blistering courtroom drama, by equal turns darkly comic and quietly devastating, this is a tale of justice, duty, and righteous dissent.

Contain warning: this show contains scenes of violence and mature content, including domestic abuse and miscarriage, descriptions of hanging and sexual assault, child death, and strong language.

event_description:
What makes for a delightful picnic? Food and drink? Poetry? Music? 

Immerse yourself into the pleasures, pastimes, and artistic heritage of Iran during the Safavid dynasty (1501-1736). A royal picnic, depicted on a large, treasured tile arch from the collections, is complemented by exceptional objects from the period.

event_description:
Join Scarborough Museum and Aruna Logendrakumar for restorative Chair Yoga sessions! These sessions are family-friendly and appropriate for all experience levels and abilities.

Aruna Logendrakumar is a Scarborough-based yoga practitioner with a passion for accessible movement and wellness. While she has taught mat yoga to participants of all ages, her specialty lies in chair yoga, with a focus on working with seniors. Aruna has trained in yoga at Annamalai University and has also studied Sitha Marma practices, deepening her knowledge of traditional healing techniques and energy points. 

This workshop is part of Scarborough Museum's Season of Celebration - a series of family-friendly activities that celebrate light, love, and joy through food, culture, and storytelling.

event_description:
Curated and conducted by Brian Current, this striking program features the world premiere of Ways of Becoming by Christina Volpini, composed for Violin Soloist Joelle Crigger and chamber orchestra, as commissioned by the Glenn Gould School of Music. 

Edgard Varèse’s Offrandes (1921) for soprano, ensemble, and six percussionists, performed by Daniele Carreon Herrera, is a groundbreaking work that marked a turning point in 20th century music. The evening culminates in Clara Iannotta’s a stir among the stars, a making way, a work of otherworldly beauty that continues to captivate audiences at the world’s most prestigious contemporary music festivals.
short_description: Curated and conducted by Brian Current, this striking program features the world premiere of Ways of Becoming by Christi

event_name: The Glenn Gould School Vocal Showcase

event_description:
This  fall celebration combines the best of Oktoberfest and Pumpkinfest, creating the ultimate weekend of fun, flavor, and festivity for all! 

Experience thrilling midway rides like the Berry-Go-Round, Swing Carousel, and the Trackless Train. Raise your steins at the exclusive beer garden, and capture seasonal memories at the pumpkin patch. 

The weekend is packed with entertainment, starting with Hip-hop and Rap Battle Friday, then Battle of the Bands  with eight talented groups, capped off by a special performance from guest artist Jason Fernandez. Enjoy Family Day, featuring balloon artists, face painting, and kids’ shows. Sample and shop food and specialty vendors offering delicious eats, Christmas lanterns, décor, and unique gifts.
short_description: This  fall celebration combines the best of Oktoberfest and Pumpkinfest, creating the ultimate weekend of fun, flavor, a

event_description:
An arts mentorship, arts employment, and arts education program that engages youth from the Jane Finch community. The program culminates in a showcase featuring talented youth and emerging voices in spoken word poetry and music. 

Organized by emerging Jamaican-Ojibwe poet Jayda Marley and Jane Finch youth Naeisha Marques, the showcase is hosted by Sydanie and features music by DJ Troy Budhu along with performances by Jayda Marley, Naiesha Marques, Jadyn Hardie-Bardy, Hamada, Brainer Nwabeke, Angelique Dancel, and workshop participants from The Spot. 

A City of Toronto Cultural Hotspot Signature Project.
short_description: An arts mentorship, arts employment, and arts education program that engages youth from the Jane Finch community. The pr

cost_notes:
Tickets will be released October 10th.

Tickets must be reserved for all participants, including children. Children under the age of 14 must be accompanied by an adult over the age of 18.
event_description:
Join Elavarasi Janakiraman and Scarborough Museum for family-friendly, hands-on henna workshops this November! Learn more about the artform, and adorn your hands with traditional henna designs that honour intergenerational artistry and cultural expression. 

Elavarasi Janakiraman of Lotus Henna Scarborough is a passionate henna artist rooted in the Scarborough community. Her love for henna began in childhood, when she would decorate her own hands with intricate designs. What started as a personal art form shared with friends and family has since blossomed into a full-time career. Today, she offers her beautiful henna services across Scarborough and the Greater Toronto Area. 

This workshop is part of Scarborough Museum's Season of Celebration - a series of family-friendly activities that celebrate light, love, and joy through food, culture, and storytelling.
short_description: Join Elavarasi Janakiraman and Scarborough Museum for family-friendly, hands-on henna workshops this November! Learn mor

cost_notes:
The event is open to the public. However, some activities at Monarch Park are limited to an access pass of $25.00. 

To participate in the scavenger hunt, participants must form teams and fundraised $250.00 minimum before the event.
event_description:
Join us for our inaugural event, a fun-filled expedition through Toronto’s vibrant east end. 

Participants visit local hot spots, complete activities, and enjoy treats along the way, to earn entries for an exciting prize draw. We'll cap off the day with a festival featuring games, live entertainment, great food and family-friendly activities. 

Funds raised will support Michael Garron Hospital’s most pressing needs and emerging priorities.
short_description:
Join us for our inaugural event, a fun-filled expedition through Toronto’s vibrant east end. 

Participants visit local

event_description:
Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and perspectives forming a kind of visual and sonic cacophony. It’s a nod to global (or even galactic) unity, and to the idea that despite all the noise and division, we’re more alike than not. 

In her Canadian debut, Intergalactic Planetary brings together imagery and works inspired by cities including Shanghai, Chongqing, Berlin, Tokyo, Bangkok and locations across the United States. Snelling explains, “Through this work, I ask: how can we move beyond our fears, borders, and egos to become more humane? Perhaps by staying curious, open, and willing to see each other more fully, we can take a small step toward connection, and even a glimmer of peace for the future”.

Join us on Nuit Blanche to view the exhibition's works, while DJ beats set the mood with dynamic sounds and enjoy two exhibition-inspired cocktails-one coffee-based and the other with an intergalactic twist.
short_description: Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and p

event_description:
"I Am Scarborough" is a community-engaged installation at Scarborough Museum, created by artist Kseniya Tsoy during her Toronto Arts Council Animating Historic Sites residency.

Over the course of several months, Scarborough residents and museum visitors came together to fold hundreds of origami butterflies and share their stories—their journeys, the lands their families come from, and their hopes and dreams.

Now gathered and suspended in flight, these butterflies embody the vibrant diversity of Scarborough—soaring high and envisioning a bright, shared future.

Experience their collective flight at Scarborough Museum through October 2025.
event_name: I am Scarborough - Installation at Scarborough Museum
short_description: "I Am Scarborough" is a community-engaged installation at Scarborough Museum, created by artist Kseniya Tsoy during her
short_name: I am Scarborough - Installation at Scarborough Museum

event_description:
Acclaimed Grammy Award-winning mandolinist, singer, songwriter, composer, and MacArthur Fellow recipient of the prestigious “Genius Grant,” Chris Thile is a multifaceted musical talent. 

Described by The Guardian as "that rare being: an all-round musician” and hailed by NPR as a "genre-defying musical genius", Thile is a founding member of the highly influential string bands Punch Brothers and Nickel Creek who has collaborated with countless luminaries like Yo-Yo Ma to Fiona Apple to Brad Mehldau.
short_description: Acclaimed Grammy Award-winning mandolinist, singer, songwriter, composer, and MacArthur Fellow recipient of the prestigi

event_description:
Extraordinary artists of The Glenn Gould School’s vocal program and the Royal Conservatory Orchestra present an Italian comedic double bill of Rossini's La cambiale di matrimonio and Puccini's Gianni Schicchi. 

Conducted by Gordon Gerrard and directed by Robert McQueen.
event_name: The Glenn Gould School Spring Opera: Serenata Italiana
short_description: Extraordinary artists of The Glenn Gould School’s vocal program and the Royal Conservatory Orchestra present an Italian
short_name: The Glenn Gould School Spring Opera: Serenata Italiana

event_description:
Hailed as a masterful and dynamic presence in the conducting world and has developed a multi-faceted portfolio as a conductor, violinist, professor, and artistic advisor. He has been celebrated for his musicality, an eye towards collaboration, innovative programming, and an engaging personality.

The Royal Conservatory Orchestra, as part of the Temerty Orchestral Program at The Glenn Gould School, is widely regarded as an outstanding ensemble and one of the best training orchestras in North America. It consists of instrumental students in the undergraduate and graduate programs of The Glenn Gould School. Graduates  have joined the ranks of the greatest orchestras in the world. 

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
event_name: Royal Conservatory Orchestra with Maestro Peter Oundjian
short_description: Hailed as a masterful and dynamic presence in the conducting world and has developed a multi-faceted portfolio as a cond
short_name: Royal Conservatory Orchestra with Maestro Peter Oundjian

event_description:
Performing alongsside mezzo-soprano Gerhild Romberger, the Toronto Mendelssohn Choir, and the Toronto Children's Chorus.

Hungary’s finest cultural ambassadors bring us Mahler’s monumental Symphony No. 3 for orchestra, mezzo-soprano, women’s choir, and children’s choir.

Founded by Iván Fischer in 1983, the Budapest Festival Orchestra is rated among the top 10 orchestras in the world, regularly performing at the most important concert venues of the international music scene. They have won two Gramophone Awards and are Grammy-nominated. Recipients of the Association of Music Critics of Argentina’s award for Best Foreign Symphony Orchestra in 2016, as well as the the Diapason d’Or for its recording of Mahler’s Symphony No. 5 in 2014, and the Italian Toblacher Komponierhäuschen Prize.
event_name: Iván Fischer conducts the Budapest Festival Orchestra
short_description: Performing alongsside mezzo-soprano Gerhild Romberger, the Toronto Mendelssohn Choir, and the Toronto Children's Chorus.
short_name: Iván Fischer conducts the Budapest Festival Orchestra

event_description:
A site-specific mural by Winnipeg-based artist Anna Binta Diallo, exploring themes of time, memory and interdependence through the metaphor of fossils. Using silhouettes of human forms assembled from found images, Diallo creates a visual narrative on the interconnectedness of the past, present and future. 

Originally exhibited at the Musée d’art contemporain de Montréal, it invites viewers to reflect on how contemporary actions and objects will serve as relics for future generations, emphasizing the importance and responsibility of shaping collective heritage.
short_description: A site-specific mural by Winnipeg-based artist Anna Binta Diallo, exploring themes of time, memory and interdependence t

event_description:
Forget awkward dating apps and overpriced dinners, this show is the ultimate antidote to the dating blues. We're back with the ultimate interactive experience.

This fully improvised romantic comedy takes the quirks, crushes, and turn-ons of real audience members and spins them into a one-of-a-kind love story. You’ll hook up, break up, live the single life, and fall in love all over again without ever leaving your seat.

Directed by Paul Bates (The Second City, Dan For Mayor), this show boasts an all-star lineup of Toronto’s funniest comedians, including Christy Bruce (Schitt’s Creek), Alastair Forbes (Join Canada, Eh!), Natalie Metcalfe (The Second City), Aurora Browne (Baroness Von Sketch Show), Jan Caruana (Because News), Sharjil Rasool (Run the Burbs), and Kris Siddiqi (The Boys). With technical wizardry by Seann Murray, this show is a comedic rollercoaster you won’t want to miss.
short_description: Forget awkward dating apps and overpriced dinners, this show is the ultimate antidote to the dating blues. We're back wi

Toronto’s largest health food event! 

Nourish to Flourish! Ready to level up your health game? This is where vibrant energy meets mindful living. Think tasty bites, killer cooking demos, wellness hacks, and all the inspo you need to eat clean and live your best life. 

Whether you’re here to discover new flavors, meet cool brands, or just vibe with fellow health lovers, this is your ultimate spot for good eats and good energy. Come hungry.

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands, better known today as Flanders, was home to revolutionary artists. 

These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then and to our world today. This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects, medieval, renaissance, baroque paintings, sculptures and more, offering a doorway to art between 1400 to 1700. 

The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks
short_description:

short_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Mast

event_description:
Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.
event_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

short_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

event_description:
An invitation to those interested in a therapeutic sculpting experience. Connect with others in an inspiring and intimate setting. Perfect for beginners and seasoned sculptors alike. Let your creativity flow in a serene and supportive environment.

Must be ages 12 and up to participant. Minor participants must be accompanied by at least one adult.
short_description: An invitation to those interested in a therapeutic sculpting experience. Connect with others in an inspiring and intimat

event_description:
Start your day with some morning yoga to gently wake up your body, breath, and senses. Each class will explore some meditation, pranayama (breathwork), and other grounding techniques for the nervous system, as well as move through some movement and stretches to gently energise the body.

Suitable for all levels including beginners. Seated, standing and lying down poses will be included with different options and students are encouraged to find and choose what works best for them.

Please bring your own mat.
short_description: Start your day with some morning yoga to gently wake up your body, breath, and senses. Each class will explore some medi

event_description:
What does home mean to you? Discover rarely seen artifacts from the City’s collections and items from community members. Explore the many ways we define, create and carry home with us. From a First World War soldier’s return ticket home to a precious family object stewarded by multiple generations, encounter belongings, voices and stories of Toronto artists, makers, entrepreneurs and community leaders as they share their unique perspectives on belonging, identity and place. These powerful objects offer fresh, heartfelt perspectives on what it means to find, make or remember home.

At Home in Toronto includes the artworks of Rebecca Baird, Carl Beam, Fred Hagan, Robert Houle, Luis Jacob, Kit Li, Raoul Olou, Yasmine Louis and Natalie Wood, as well as loaned works by local artists Doug Brown and Frantz Brent-Harris.
short_description: What does home mean to you? Discover rarely seen artifacts from the City’s collections and items from community members.

At Home in Toronto includes the artworks of Rebecca Baird, Carl Beam, Fred Hagan, Robert Houle, Luis Jacob, Kit Li, Raoul Olou, Yasmine Louis and Natalie Wood, as well as loaned works by local artists Doug Brown and Frantz Brent-Harris.
short_description: What does home mean to you? Discover rarely seen artifacts from the City’s collections and items from community members.

event_description:
Join us on a chilling and thrilling journey through the dark history of the city as we delve into the world of ghosts, graveyards, hangings, and haunts.

 Prepare to be captivated by spine-tingling ghost stories about haunted theatres, unsolved mysteries, secrets hiding in plain sight, and spooky historic buildings. Our outdoor tour will take you on a hair-raising paranormal adventure, departing from the courtyard in front of the Hockey Hall of Fame. 

Get ready to see the city in a whole new light, or rather, darkness, as you uncover the eerie and supernatural tales that lurk in its shadows.
short_description: Join us on a chilling and thrilling journey through the dark history of the city as we delve into the world of ghosts, g

event_description:
Two internationally acclaimed  experiences, SÉANCE and FLIGHT, are coming. 

Staged inside purpose-built 40-foot shipping containers, these genre-defying works use complete darkness, 360° binaural audio, and precisely timed physical and environmental effects to create psychologically charged alternate realities.

The Toronto season brings two of the company’s most toured experiences to Canada for the first time. With over 700,000 attendees worldwide and appearances of their work at Venice Film Festival, Tribeca, SXSW, and Edinburgh Fringe, Toronto is now invited also to step inside the dark.
short_description:
Two internationally acclaimed  experiences, SÉANCE and FLIGHT, are coming. 

Staged inside purpose-built 40-foot shippin

event_description:
Step into the world of teas with a guided connoisseur-led tasting of classic, herbal, and signature tea blends. 

Enjoy chef-inspired food pairings, bite size snacks and delicacies while sipping the teas. Learn the art of making a chai latte with spices like cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, clove and pepper. Create 3 seasonal special lattes and make yourself a holiday tea cocktail.

Connect with a community of tea lovers over flavor, culture and wellness.
event_name: Holiday Tea Tasting Experience and Seasonal Chai Latte Masterclass

event_description: Take a break in Old City Hall’s open-air courtyard — a hidden oasis in the heart of downtown. Bring your lunch, meet up with friends or simply enjoy the peaceful surroundings and heritage architecture. While you're here, look up to spot the clock tower's four gargoyles — part of the original 1899 design and removed in 1938 and reinstalled in 2002 using modern materials.

event_description:
As night falls, we’ll set out on a lantern-lit stroll along the cobblestone streets of the historic Distillery District, one of Toronto’s most haunted spots! 

Learn about the tragic events that left their mark and hear spine-chilling tales of paranormal encounters from this iconic area. Feel the goosebumps rise as you explore the narrow alleyways and hidden corners where spirits are said to lurk. 

Whether you’re a history buff, a ghost enthusiast, or just looking for a unique experience, this outdoor tour is sure to captivate your imagination. Get ready to experience the thrills and chills like never before.
event_name: Spirits of the Distillery District Ghost Tour
short_description: As night falls, we’ll set out on a lantern-lit stroll along the cobblestone streets of the historic Distillery District,
short_name: Spirits of the Distillery District Ghost Tour

Drop by with your pup for a spook-tacular, fun-filled day. Enjoy a fang-tastic vendor market, where you can find a variety of products and services for your furbabies! Show off your furry friends and their costumes for some treats before hitting the dog park. Trick or (dog) treat!

Come visit and show us your costumes, take pictures and browse through delicious dog treats and accessories for your furry friend. 

Who can resist the eerie-istable, cuteness overload of this pawsitively exciting event? No one!

Not a pawrent? Not a pup-blem, everyone is welcome!

event_description:
"I Am Scarborough" is a community-engaged installation at Scarborough Museum, created by artist Kseniya Tsoy during her Toronto Arts Council Animating Historic Sites residency.

Over the course of several months, Scarborough residents and museum visitors came together to fold hundreds of origami butterflies and share their stories—their journeys, the lands their families come from, and their hopes and dreams.

Now gathered and suspended in flight, these butterflies embody the vibrant diversity of Scarborough—soaring high and envisioning a bright, shared future.

Experience their collective flight at Scarborough Museum through October 2025.
event_name: I am Scarborough - Installation at Scarborough Museum

short_name: I am Scarborough - Installation at Scarborough Museum

event_description:
What makes for a delightful picnic? Food and drink? Poetry? Music? 

Immerse yourself into the pleasures, pastimes, and artistic heritage of Iran during the Safavid dynasty (1501-1736). A royal picnic, depicted on a large, treasured tile arch from the collections, is complemented by exceptional objects from the period.

A city-wide celebration where climate meets culture, community, and innovation.

From art shows, live music, and food & agriculture pop-ups to tech showcases, finance talks, health forums, and grassroots community events, there’s something for everyone.

Join us as Toronto steps onto the global stage with bold ideas and real solutions.

event_description:
A quiet lake in Ontario is making a lot of noise.

Sediments from the bottom of a small lake in Ontario are revealing a remarkable record of our impact on the planet.

Just outside Toronto, Ontario lies Crawford Lake, a significant site offering a unique, comprehensive 1,000-year record of human impacts - local, regional, and global.

event_description:
Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.
event_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

short_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands, better known today as Flanders, was home to revolutionary artists. 

These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then and to our world today. This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects, medieval, renaissance, baroque paintings, sculptures and more, offering a doorway to art between 1400 to 1700. 

The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks

event_description:
Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.
event_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

event_description:
This  fall celebration combines the best of Oktoberfest and Pumpkinfest, creating the ultimate weekend of fun, flavor, and festivity for all! 

Experience thrilling midway rides like the Berry-Go-Round, Swing Carousel, and the Trackless Train. Raise your steins at the exclusive beer garden, and capture seasonal memories at the pumpkin patch. 

The weekend is packed with entertainment, starting with Hip-hop and Rap Battle Friday, then Battle of the Bands  with eight talented groups, capped off by a special performance from guest artist Jason Fernandez. Enjoy Family Day, featuring balloon artists, face painting, and kids’ shows. Sample and shop food and specialty vendors offering delicious eats, Christmas lanterns, décor, and unique gifts.
short_description: This  fall celebration combines the best of Oktoberfest and Pumpkinfest, creating the ultimate weekend of fun, flavor, a

event_description:
The weather outside is frightful! Light up your winter with this delightful comedy spectacular brimming with glee and holiday cheer! 

Enjoy a merry mix of classic sketches from our celebrated archives, hilarious new material, and the uproarious improv antics that have made us legendary. It’s a perfect way to add laughter and joy to your holiday season!

event_description:
This pop-up installation explores the compelling stories and experiences of Toronto’s diverse communities who have fought for their sense of home, belonging and identity during periods of conflict and peace. 

This installation is created in partnership with the Toronto Metropolitan University's Masters of Digital Media program.
event_name: Echoes of Home: Pop-Up Exhibit at Fort York
short_description: This pop-up installation explores the compelling stories and experiences of Toronto’s diverse communities who have

event_description:
One of the longest running markets of its kind in Toronto, opening annually for 46 years. With its rich and storied history, the market has become a staple event that the Weston community enjoys visiting every year. Generations of families have visited to enjoy some farm fresh produce, dairy, meats, eggs and finely prepared foods, as well as local artisans showcasing their work to the community.

We look forward to welcoming new friends to join us!
short_description: One of the longest running markets of its kind in Toronto, opening annually for 46 years. With its rich and storied hist

event_description:
Get ready for the ultimate foodie experience! Treat yourself to delicious food from incredible chefs and raise a glass to being with friends and enjoying life. 

With over 200 exhibits, including Master Chef demos, international cuisine, food trucks, wine tasting, mixology classes, live music, DJ lounge, and dance parties. Indulge in delicious food and drink from some of the city’s top chefs and mixologists. Get ready to chow down and party on!
short_description: Get ready for the ultimate foodie experience! Treat yourself to delicious food from incredible chefs and raise a glass t

event_description:
Every year, responding to pressure to work outside their home countries, temporary migrant workers come to Canada to complete essential work that sustains the Canadian economy and communities; harvesting produce, caring for families, constructing houses, cooking meals, and more.

Most Canadians know nothing of the exploitation many migrant workers face.

With input and collaboration of former and current migrant farmworkers, you are invited to this forum theatre production about the experience of migrant farmworkers in Ontario.

This is an interactive presentation that was created through interviews and conversations with migrant workers who shared their experiences. After seeing the play, audiences will be invited to discuss the issues, direct the actors, or roleplay their ideas to discover how we can all create positive change.
event_name: Harvest Justice: Twice the Speed of Lightning
short_description: Every year, responding to pressure to work outside their home countries, temporary migrant workers come to Canada to com
short_name: Harvest Justice: Twice the Speed of Lightning

event_description: Guy Davis is easily one of the finest proponents of acoustic blues in the world. He has performed across North America, Europe, the UK, Australia and South America, and has played hundreds of shows in Canada, selling out theatres from coast to coast and performing in all ten provinces and two territories. A great story teller, a unique voice and as brilliant on the harp as he is on the guitar, Guy has earned his place as one of the true greats of the current generation of blues artists.

event_description: Canada’s legendary prairie folk musician, is celebrating 47 years in show business this year. The JUNO award-winning singer-songwriter is a perennial favourite on the folk music scene. Her beautiful original songs blur musical lines, embracing elements of gospel, country and western, and bluegrass. A popular solo performer, don’t miss Connie Kaldor on guitar and piano.
short_description: Canada’s legendary prairie folk musician, is celebrating 47 years in show business this year. The JUNO award-winning sin

event_description:
Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and perspectives forming a kind of visual and sonic cacophony. It’s a nod to global (or even galactic) unity, and to the idea that despite all the noise and division, we’re more alike than not. 

In her Canadian debut, Intergalactic Planetary brings together imagery and works inspired by cities including Shanghai, Chongqing, Berlin, Tokyo, Bangkok and locations across the United States. Snelling explains, “Through this work, I ask: how can we move beyond our fears, borders, and egos to become more humane? Perhaps by staying curious, open, and willing to see each other more fully, we can take a small step toward connection, and even a glimmer of peace for the future”.

Join us on Nuit Blanche to view the exhibition's works, while DJ beats set the mood with dynamic sounds and enjoy two exhibition-inspired cocktails-one coffee-based and the other with an intergalactic twist.
short_description: Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and p

event_description:
Mr. Yun has been hailed by Pianist Magazine as a “poet of the keyboard” and The Philadelphia Inquirer noted his thrilling performance and “interpretive flashes that point to an emergent big personality: moments of grandness or deep expressivity”. 

He made his Carnegie Hall debut in 2023-24 under the baton of Yannick Nézet-Séguin with Orchestre Métropolitain, following his 2022-23 debut with the Philadelphia Orchestra. Mr. Yun has appeared recently with the Toronto Symphony Orchestra, Baltimore Symphony, Calgary Philharmonic, Buffalo Philharmonic, Hamilton Philharmonic, and Rhode Island Philharmonic; outside North America, he has recently appeared with Orchestre de Chambre de Paris and Shanghai Symphony Orchestra.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
short_description: Mr. Yun has been hailed by Pianist Magazine as a “poet of the keyboard” and The Philadelphia Inquirer noted his thrillin
