event_description:
Join Scarborough Museum for a Season of Celebration! Embrace the spirit of light, love, and joy through a series of family-friendly activities centered on food, culture, and storytelling.  

Enjoy gingerbread decorating, family-friendly winter crafts and weekly workshops led by guest facilitators, including chair yoga, henna and more! See additional listings for more details. 

Community Feature: Sample a rotating selection of warm drinks and finger foods from around the world, curated by the Scarborough Museum Youth Collective and participants of Scarborough Museum’s Newcomer Storytelling Circles. Try something new or enjoy an old favourite, learn more about the stories behind these sips and bites, and share your own stories of light and warmth in our community jar!  

Treats will be available first come-first served, while quantities last.
event_name: Season of Celebration at Scarborough Museum
short_description: Join Scarborough Museum for a Season of Celebration! Embrace the spirit of light, love, and joy through a series of fami
short_name: Season of Celebration at Scarborough Museum

event_description:
Returning for its eleventh annual season, featuring more than 30 Canadian and international artists.

Under the new leadership of Festival Director Lily Sutherland and Artistic Director Robert Binet, the festival showcases three mixed Signature Programmes: AFROFUSION, HOMEGROWN, and KATHAK and BALLET. 

Festival highlights include performances from The Royal Ballet, Kathak sensations Tanveer Alam and Barkha Patel, and a world premiere from Artist-in-Residence Esie Mensah, among other local and international dance artists. 

New this year, Up Next at OCAD University spotlights groundbreaking artists in an audience directed experience, including timed entry and freedom to move throughout the space. Intimate Pairings offers the exhilaration of a front row seat in an easily enjoyable setting.
short_description:
Returning for its eleventh annual season, featuring more than 30 Canadian and international artists.

Under the new lead

event_description:
What makes for a delightful picnic? Food and drink? Poetry? Music? 

Immerse yourself into the pleasures, pastimes, and artistic heritage of Iran during the Safavid dynasty (1501-1736). A royal picnic, depicted on a large, treasured tile arch from the collections, is complemented by exceptional objects from the period.

What adults often overlook is children’s unique power: their ability to see right through them.

event_description:
Bold, passionate, and innovative, Taiwanese American Mei-Ann Chen is renowned as one of the most versatile and dynamic conductors on the podium today, praised for the energy and enthusiasm with which she infuses orchestras and performances. 

A passionate advocate for music education, Ms. Chen dedicates significant time in mentoring young conductors through various programs, including the Chicago Sinfonietta Freeman Conducting Fellowship program and the Taki Alsop Fellowship, and conducts ensembles at important educational institutions, both nationally and abroad. 

Highly regarded as a compelling communicator and a creative leader both on and off the podium, and a sought-after guest conductor, she has appeared with distinguished orchestras throughout the Americas, Europe, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, and Scandinavia, and continues to expand her relationships with over 150 orchestras worldwide.
event_name: Royal Conservatory Orchestra with Conductor Mei-Ann Chen
short_description: Bold, passionate, and innovative, Taiwanese American Mei-Ann Chen is renowned as one of the most versatile and dynamic c
short_name: Royal Conservatory Orchestra with Conductor Mei-Ann Chen

event_description:
Juno Award winner, UNESCO Ambassador, and alumnus of The Royal Conservatory’s Glenn Gould School, Jan Lisiecki plays Preludes by Chopin, Bach, Messiaen, and Rachmaninov.

The remarkable pianist has been described by the BBC Music Magazine as “perhaps the most 'complete' pianist of his age". His interpretations and technique speak to a maturity beyond his age. He has worked closely with conductors such as Antonio Pappano, Yannick Nézet-Séguin, Daniel Harding, Manfred Honeck, and Claudio Abbado. The New York Times has called him “a pianist who makes every note count.” 

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.

You are invited to a community paint activation at Canoe Landing Park!

Award-winning multi-disciplinary creative Ben Johnston will be painting a new large-scale floor mural and community members, residents, and visitors are invited to take part in guided after-work paint sessions and add their own brushstrokes as this collaborative artwork comes to life.

Celebrate the completion of the mural with a community gathering featuring a DJ set by Gimmemar and drop-in salsa lessons from Salsa in the Heart.

event_description:
The multiple Grammy Award nominated ensemble performs works by Frederick Block, Jerzy Fitelberg, Arthur Willner in a program to be performed later in New York.

Composed of the senior faculty of The Royal Conservatory's Glenn Gould School, with special guests drawn from the organization's most accomplished students and alumni, the ARC Ensemble is one of Canada's most distinguished cultural ambassadors. The research and recovery of works suppressed and marginalized under the 20th century's repressive regimes remains its focus, a growing number of which have now rejoined the repertoire.

“As always with this ensemble, performances could hardly be bettered in terms of execution and commitment.” - Gramophone.

event_description:
This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

Through dozens of interactives and life-sized models, including a life-size head of the huge extinct Megalodon, join us for a unique look at these magnificent creatures, their habitats, hunting techniques, and the conservation threats that they face.
short_description: This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding di

event_description:
Ólafsson's remarkable originality has made an unforgettable impact. His album, Johann Sebastian Bach, on Deutsche Grammophon was the Best Instrumental Album and Album of the Year at the BBC Music Magazine Awards 2019. 

He has been called “Iceland’s Glenn Gould” by The New York Times, and was named Artist of the Year at the Gramophone Awards in 2019 and Instrumentalist of the Year by Musical America in 2024. 

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
event_name: SOLD OUT Víkingur Ólafsson on Piano

Featuring over 70 original artworks created outdoors at Toronto Botanical Garden and Edwards Gardens, this curated, site-specific show invites visitors to experience the gardens through the eyes of the artists who paint here, capturing moments of light, movement, and the essence of the natural world.

event_description:
A celebration of the city’s passion for basketball and the remarkable stories of legendary players who changed the game. Join us and experience basketball history come to life through augmented reality, where you can custom design your own basketball jersey.

Even before the Toronto Raptors and the rallying cry, “We the North” became a slogan, for over a century, basketball in Toronto was deeply rooted in the evolving social and cultural conditions of our city and its people.  

From the Canadian invention of basketball to the early women’s game in 1895, to the first professional basketball game played by the short-lived Toronto Huskies in 1946, and the recent creation of the Toronto Tempo WNBA team, these and many other milestones chart the sport’s development in the city.
short_description: A celebration of the city’s passion for basketball and the remarkable stories of legendary players who changed the game.

event_description:
Calling all Swifties! A brand new, one-of-a-kind escape room experience is opening its doors, and it’s “Taylor”-made for fans of Taylor Swift. Blending the thrill of classic escape challenges with trivia and Easter eggs from Taylor's iconic career, this immersive adventure offers something completely unique — and something secret too.

The Swiftie Session invites groups to step into a world where puzzles meet pop culture. Solve clues rooted in Taylor’s lyrics, albums, and eras as you race against the clock to “Shake It Off” and break free!

The experience doesn’t stop at the final lock. We’re offering an exclusive bundle package for groups to extend the fun with a private karaoke party room, featuring, sing-alongs to Taylor’s new album, props & photo ops and friendship bracelet workshops.
short_description: Calling all Swifties! A brand new, one-of-a-kind escape room experience is opening its doors, and it’s “Taylor”-made for

event_description:
From Leonardo Da Vinci to contemporary creators, the intriguing forms of animal skulls have long fascinated artists. Learn artist techniques for drawing realistic skulls using the Nature Centre’s bone collection. 

Beginners welcome, all materials provided.

For participants ages 18 and up.
short_description: From Leonardo Da Vinci to contemporary creators, the intriguing forms of animal skulls have long fascinated artists. Lea

event_description:
We are pleased to bring you the fifth annual Greek International Film Festival Tour of Canada (GIFFT).

This is a Canadian national film festival that will take place in 11 Canadian cities simultaneously. Those cities include: Toronto, Vancouver, Edmonton, Calgary, Regina, Winnipeg, London (Ontario), Hamilton/Niagara, Ottawa, and Halifax.

GIFFT is a showcase and celebration of Greek cinema and filmmakers of Greek Heritage. This festival will provide exciting platform for directors, writers, producers, and actors of Greek Heritage to showcase their exceptional art across Canada.
short_description:
We are pleased to bring you the fifth annual Greek International Film Festival Tour of Canada (GIFFT).

This is a Canadi

event_description:
Join us for an informative session on Cultural Hotspot's SPARK and Signature Funding grants. We're excited to offer this opportunity for artists, creatives, artist collectives, grassroots and resident-led groups and small to midsized community organizations based in, or who may have been displaced from, living or working in Kingston-Galloway/Orton Park (KGO) for any reason. We are offering up to $9,000 for SPARK projects and up to $20,000 for Signature projects.

During a session, participants will learn about the objectives and eligibility criteria of SPARK and Signature Funding, gain insights into the application process, including tips for crafting a competitive proposal, hear success stories from past grant recipients and learn from their experiences, engage in a Q&A session with the Cultural Hotspot team to clarify any doubts or queries, network with fellow KGO artists, creatives and art administrators to foster collaboration and community building.
event_name: Cultural Hotspot SPARK & Signature Funding: Information Sessions

Explore the timeless interiors of Old City Hall and marvel at the grand staircase, stunning murals, and the historic former City Council Chamber — each space a witness to Toronto’s past. Enjoy its Romanesque Revival architecture, historic courtrooms and intricate iron finishings. Completed in 1899 and designed by architect E.J. Lennox, the building served as the city's municipal hub for more than 60 years.

Click on the event website link under contact information to access an audio tour.

event_description: Join us for over 400 juried, original works of art created by The Art Guild of Scarborough artists, many of whom will be in attendance.  The art is a variety of mediums including watercolour, pastel, oil, acrylic, ink, sculpture and mixed media.  As well, our selection of mini-art returns by popular demand.  More than 50 artists have each created a mini-panel to be displayed and sold with its own mini-easel.

A spoken word poetry program for youth in the Jane and Finch community. Youth will learn the fundamentals of spoken word with Jayda Marley and Naiesha Marques and have the opportunity to present what they have learned at a final showcase for family and friends. 

A City of Toronto Cultural Hotspot Signature Project.

event_description:
Known as West Africa’s greatest band, Senegal’s very own brings their mix of Afro-Cuban style, international pop, traditional griot music, and mellifluous rhythms to Koerner Hall. Congolese rumba opens the night.

For 55 years, Orchestra Baobab has filled venues and festivals across the globe with dancing crowds. Their success story began in Dakar, where the group picked up Cuban styles like son and pachanga. Starting at Club Baobab, built around the iconic tree, the group travelled extensively through West Africa. All kinds of influences were integrated into the "Baobab sound" and the band continues to make their sound more thrilling than ever with lively twists and energetic additions.
event_name: Orchestra Baobab with Special Guest Mis Blandine
short_description: Known as West Africa’s greatest band, Senegal’s very own brings their mix of Afro-Cuban style, international pop, tradit
short_name: Orchestra Baobab with Special Guest Mis Blandine

cost_notes: Free 25 and under program available, see website for details.
event_description:
Rural England, 1759. Halley’s Comet burns in the sky, and a young woman is sentenced to hang. But when she tries to escape the noose by claiming to be pregnant, a jury of twelve women are gathered to decide whether she is telling the truth. As tensions rise, their task becomes a reckoning: with the law, with power, and with the roles they’re forced to play in a world that silences them.

Tony-Award Nominee Lucy Kirkwood’s The Welkin (Chimerica, The Children) is a bold and blistering courtroom drama, by equal turns darkly comic and quietly devastating, this is a tale of justice, duty, and righteous dissent.

Contain warning: this show contains scenes of violence and mature content, including domestic abuse and miscarriage, descriptions of hanging and sexual assault, child death, and strong language.
short_description: Rural England, 1759. Halley’s Comet burns in the sky, and a young woman is sentenced to hang. But when she tries to esca

cost_notes: Soulpepper Theatre offers a Free 25 & Under program. See website for details.
event_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reunites to pre-game their twentieth high school reunion, but nostalgia quickly turns into something darker. 

As drinks flow and old wounds resurface, they confront the choices that shaped them, the friendships that endured or crumbled, and the presence of something, or someone they can’t escape. 

Sharp, theatrical, and deeply moving, this is a reckoning for elder millennials, caught between who they were, who they’ve become, and the world they never saw coming. When the night ends, will they still recognize themselves?
short_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reun

event_description:
One of Toronto's oldest holiday traditions. 

First staged here in 1938, this pageant began in St. Martin-in-the-Fields church in London, England in 1928. Queen Elizabeth and her sister Margaret were taken to see it when they were little girls. The story of the Nativity is told through a series of narrated scenes linked by beautiful organ music and carols from an unseen choir.   

Close to 50 volunteers, including babies who take turns playing the role of baby Jesus, perform in the cast. The Church of the Holy Trinity, a 178-year-old architectural treasure, brings its own charm to the show.  ASL interpretation is available on Friday, December 19th.

event_description:
Forming in 2012 at the Royal College of Music, London, this Amsterdam-based trio have appeared on Europe’s major stages: Wigmore Hall, Berlin’s Konzerthaus, and the Concertgebouw. 

Internationally lauded, they won the 2016 Kersjes Prijs (Netherlands) and 2018 Nordmetall-Ensemble (Mecklenburg Festival). Their 2023 Ravel, Shostakovich album was selected as a chamber choice BBC Music Magazine.

They play rare instruments by Guadagnini (1783) and Ceruti (1815). Their program includes piano trios by Haydn, Schumann, and Beethoven, Op. 97 Archduke.
short_description: Forming in 2012 at the Royal College of Music, London, this Amsterdam-based trio have appeared on Europe’s major stages:

event_description:
What to Expect:

In this beginner-friendly session, you’ll learn how to bring a print on fabric using sublimation and vinyl printing methods. With guided instruction, you’ll get familiar with tools like the sublimation printer, smart cutting machine, and heat press, giving you the skills to create your wearable art from start to finish.

Make Custom Pieces: Each participant will design and print on one shirt and/or one tote bag—the shirt is a white unisex classic T-shirt, and the tote bag is a cream coloured, made of durable canvas material. You'll get to experiment with both sublimation transfers and heat-pressed vinyl! Where them home that day if you'd like!

Who Should Join: No experience needed! Perfect for crafters, creatives, and curious beginners. Ages 10+ (those under 16 must be accompanied by a paying adult).

Please see more Paint Workshops here: https://www.artboxstudiogallery.com/paint-workshops
short_description:

event_description:
Learn how to bring a print on fabric using sublimation and vinyl printing methods. With guided instruction, you’ll get familiar with tools like the sublimation printer, smart cutting machine, and heat press, giving you the skills to create your wearable art from start to finish.

Each participant will design and print on one shirt and/or one tote bag. You'll get to experiment with both sublimation transfers and heat-pressed vinyl and wear your creation home, if you would like!

No experience needed! Perfect for crafters, creatives, and curious beginners, ages 10 and up. Minor participants must be accompanied by an adult.
short_description: Learn how to bring a print on fabric using sublimation and vinyl printing methods. With guided instruction, you’ll get f

cost_notes: Subject to dynamic pricing, please see website for details. Free for Members.
event_description:
Sharks have intrigued humans for as long as we have explored the oceans. The terrifying monster from the movie Jaws is what many might imagine when they think of these animals, but they are far more fascinating and complex than their depiction in popular culture.

This exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research, and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

event_description:
Sharks have intrigued humans for as long as we have explored the oceans. The terrifying monster from the movie Jaws is what many might imagine when they think of these animals, but they are far more fascinating and complex than their depiction in popular culture.

This exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research, and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

event_description:
Join us for an unforgettable evening of history, mystery, and the supernatural. Acclaimed author Ann McDougall will present a reading from her newly published book, A Ghost in the Room: Supernatural Adventures in Historic Houses, followed by an immersive exploration of historic techniques used in attempts to communicate with the dead  (both sincere and duplicitous).
Step inside the historic house as we uncover the Austin family's customs surrounding death and mourning, as well as the popularity of Spiritualism from mid 19th through the early 20th century. Guests will explore why the desire to communicate with the dead surged during the interwar period, and how grief and psychological trauma opened doors for both sincere belief and deception.
This event blends scholarly insight with Halloween thrill, debunking the myths while honoring the very human reasons we seek to connect with the beyond.
Costumes welcome.
Ages 12+, ages 12-16 must be accompanied by a ticketed adult.
event_name: A Skeptic’s Séance: Psychology and the Supernatural at Spadina Museum
short_description: Join us for an unforgettable evening of history, mystery, and the supernatural. Acclaimed author Ann McDougall will pres
short_name: A Skeptic’s Séance: Psychology and the Supernatural at Spadi

event_description:
Discover the beauty and diversity of Canada!

This remarkable performance celebrates our rich cultural tapestry and natural wonders, featuring compositions by Canadian composers that reflect the spirit, landscapes, and stories of our great nation. From stirring classical melodies to innovative new works, we're bringin music to life. Don’t miss this unforgettable evening of artistry, emotion, and national pride that showcases the true essence of our musical heritage. Featuring guest artist Mireille Asselin.

event_description:
In the chaos of urban life, we often forget to take a moment to breathe. Take in a moment of stillness, as we inviting visitors to stand beneath something that feels alive.

The outdoor installation, made from a suspended grid of copper leaves, reimagines the shelter of a forest canopy with each leaf individually cut and hung to form a floating canopy above. By day, the leaves catch the light and scatter soft shadows across the ground. By night, lighting transforms the installation, casting intricate patterns on surrounding surfaces and shifting the atmosphere of the space entirely. As wind moves through the piece, the leaves gently sway and rustle, adding a subtle layer of sound to the experience.

Responding to its surroundings and shifting with the light, weather and movement of people passing beneath it, this work offers a dynamic and reflective space in the heart of the city. 

Designed by RAW Works, with Roland Rom Colthoff, Suleman Khan, Elmira Yousefi and Aaron Hendershot.
short_description: In the chaos of urban life, we often forget to take a moment to breathe. Take in a moment of stillness, as we inviting v

event_description:
What if our lives were measured not by the hours on a clock, but by the rhythm of our emotions, memories, and relationships?

Violinist Mark Fewer and percussionist Aiyun Huang step into a surreal, poetic soundworld where time becomes a living presence. Through music, theatre, and light, the work asks: Can we ever be truly in sync with another person? What happens when our rhythms fall out of step? How do love and memory shape our sense of time?

Unfolding in a series of vivid scenes, each exploring a different human temporality, violin and percussion weave an artistic meditation on love, time, and the quest for harmony with the world.

At once abstract and deeply emotional, enjoy this one-of-a-kind performance experience.
short_description: What if our lives were measured not by the hours on a clock, but by the rhythm of our emotions, memories, and relationsh

event_description:
Join Autism Ontario and the Canada Lands Company at Downsview Park for a Creepy Crawlers program.  

Let’s take a closer look at the tiny creatures that creep and crawl in Downsview Park. Dig in the dirt, collect worms, and explore all the living things around us.

Look closer to discover the secret world all around us! Participants will dig in the mud, investigate logs and participate in flower checks to explore the reptiles, amphibians and invertebrates living in the park.

Once registered and paid, refunds will not be issued. Autism Ontario does not offer transfer-of-care. Caregivers must attend and remain on-site with their child.
short_description:
Join Autism Ontario and the Canada Lands Company at Downsview Park for a Creepy Crawlers program.  

Let’s take a closer

event_description:
Experience Toronto like never before with this double-decker night tour. Step aboard an iconic open-top bus and embark on an enchanting journey through the sparkling city lights. Marvel at Toronto's iconic landmarks as they come to life under the night sky.

From the towering CN Tower to the historic Old Town, dive into the sights at your guide illuminates the city's rich history and vibrant culture. With panoramic views from the open-air top deck, capture breathtaking sights and create unforgettable memories.

Enjoy an evening of wonder and discovery on a double-decker night tour of Toronto with guaranteed seating on the upper level.
short_description: Experience Toronto like never before with this double-decker night tour. Step aboard an iconic open-top bus and embark o

event_description:
One of the most revered artists of his generation, Stephen Kovacevich performs piano sonatas by Beethoven, Schubert, and Berg. 

With an international career spanning more than six decades, Kovacevich has long been one of the world’s most sought-after performers. This program includes Alban Berg: Piano Sonata, op. 1, Ludwig van Beethoven: Piano Sonata No. 31 in A flat Major, op. 110 and Franz Schubert: Piano Sonata in B flat Major, D. 960.

“A musician who is totally immersed in his craft, his interpretations are like no one else's and always come straight from the heart: musical messages of wisdom, peace, resignation and hope.” - Washington Post

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
short_description: One of the most revered artists of his generation, Stephen Kovacevich performs piano sonatas by Beethoven, Schubert, and

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands — better known today as Flanders — was home to revolutionary artists. These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then - and to our world today. 

This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects — medieval, Renaissance, and baroque paintings, sculptures and more — offers a doorway into the Southern Netherlands of 1400 to 1700. The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks

short_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Mast

event_description:
Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.
event_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

short_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

event_description:
Acclaimed tenor Romulo Delgado is accompanied by the Viva Mexico Mariachi Band for an evening showcasing the passion and excitement of authentic Mexican Mariachi music. 

Joyous and contagious in spirit, Mariachi captivates audiences around the world. This beautiful yet challenging tradition calls for a lead singer who combines masterful vocal technique with dramatic intensity. The Globe and Mail have described Delgado delivers as “one of Canada’s most unique performing artists.".
event_name: Mariachi Fiesta with Tenor Romulo Delgado

short_name: Mariachi Fiesta with Tenor Romulo Delgado

This pop-up installation explores the compelling stories and experiences of Toronto’s diverse communities who have fought for their sense of home, belonging and identity during periods of conflict and peace.

This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

Through dozens of interactives and life-sized models, including a life-size head of the huge extinct Megalodon, join us for a unique look at these magnificent creatures, their habitats, hunting techniques, and the conservation threats that they face.

event_description:
Photography omes alive with dance, music, and spoken word performances. Nine photographic artists join together with professionals in the fields of dance, poetry, drama, and music to present an afternoon of visual art with Ekphrasis performances in response to the photographs. 

Photographic artists are Linda Briskin, Brianna Caryll, Lucie Collins, Martha Davis, Vivian East, Kye Marshall, Jana Skarecky, Patricia Stamp, and Henrietta Walmark.

Performers responding to the visual works are dancer Brianna Clarke, musicians Taivi Alexander, Kye Marshall and Jana Skarecky, dramatists Angie Littlefield and Annie Rosenberg and poets Kate Marshall Flaherty, Bianca Lakoseljac, JC Sulzenko and Donna Wootton.

event_description:
Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.
event_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition
short_description: Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagi
short_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.

event_description:
In the chaos of urban life, we often forget to take a moment to breathe. Take in a moment of stillness, as we inviting visitors to stand beneath something that feels alive.

The outdoor installation, made from a suspended grid of copper leaves, reimagines the shelter of a forest canopy with each leaf individually cut and hung to form a floating canopy above. By day, the leaves catch the light and scatter soft shadows across the ground. By night, lighting transforms the installation, casting intricate patterns on surrounding surfaces and shifting the atmosphere of the space entirely. As wind moves through the piece, the leaves gently sway and rustle, adding a subtle layer of sound to the experience.

Responding to its surroundings and shifting with the light, weather and movement of people passing beneath it, this work offers a dynamic and reflective space in the heart of the city. 

Designed by RAW Works, with Roland Rom Colthoff, Suleman Khan, Elmira Yousefi and Aaron Hendershot.
short_description: In the chaos of urban life, we often forget to take a moment to breathe. Take in a moment of stillness, as we inviting v

event_description:
Classical music and jazz collide as two of today’s most prolific and compelling pianists join forces to create a unique program featuring jazz exploration, classical romanticism, and pop allure.

Grammy Award-winning jazz pianist Brad Mehldau has recorded and performed extensively since the early 1990s. He is first and foremost an improviser and greatly cherishes the surprise and wonder that can occur from a spontaneous musical idea that is expressed directly, in real time. But he also has a deep fascination for the formal architecture of music, and it informs everything he plays. The two sides of Mehldau’s personality – the improviser and the formalist – play off each other, and the effect is often something like controlled chaos. 

Kirill Gerstein has established himself as one of today’s most prolific and compelling performers.
short_description: Classical music and jazz collide as two of today’s most prolific and compelling pianists join forces to create a unique

event_description:
Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legendary outlaw tale takes on a bold twist - our Robin is a spirited, savvy heroine leading her merry band of misfits in a fight for justice and kindness.  

Join Robin and her friends on a medieval romp through merry old Torontoshire! Journey through the lush forests of High Park, go head-to-head with the greedy Prince John, and rescue those in need - all with a hearty dose of laughter, pop hits, and plenty of surprises. 

Robin Hood delivers all the Panto fun you love, a sparkling spoof on a classic tale, hilarious comedy, dazzling musical numbers, and an intergenerational celebration that's perfect for the whole family.  

Grab your loved ones, don your green tights, and join us for a experience full of mischief, melody, and meaning.
event_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical
short_description:
Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legen
short_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

event_description:
This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

Through dozens of interactives and life-sized models, including a life-size head of the huge extinct Megalodon, join us for a unique look at these magnificent creatures, their habitats, hunting techniques, and the conservation threats that they face.
short_description: This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding di

event_description: Explore the majestic gothic architecture and picturesque tree-lined paths of the campus as we uncover its eerie history and spine-chilling ghostly tales. As we stroll through the historic grounds, our expert guides will captivate you with chilling stories of ghostly sightings and supernatural phenomena witnessed by students, faculty, and visitors alike. Whether you’re a history buff, a believer in the paranormal, a student or alum, or just looking for a unique and spooky evening experience in Toronto, our Campus Secrets & Spectres ghost tour will leave you with a sense of wonder and intrigue as we reveal the haunted secrets of the University of Toronto’s downtown campus.
event_name: Campus Secrets and Spectres – University of Toronto Ghost Tour
short_description: Explore the majestic gothic architecture and picturesque tree-lined paths of the campus as we uncover its eerie history
short_name: Campus Secrets and Spectres – University of Toronto Ghost To

event_description:
Discover how homes shape identity through the Austin family story and contemporary art at Spadina Museum. Reimagine history, reframe home.

“Home at Spadina Museum” considers how people are influenced by their home. We look at those who make it a home and those who live in it are shaped by domestic spaces. Through interpretation of the Austin family and into contemporary art, we will analyze what makes a home. Re-Imagining the Historic House Museum: A Workplace for Women. 

Step into “Home at Spadina Museum” and explore how homes are shaped by the people who live and work in them. From the Austin family to contemporary art, discover untold stories of women’s labour, care, and community. Reimagine the historic house as both a home and a workplace.

As you explore the exhibition, we invite you to reflect: "What does home mean to you?"

We are grateful to our community partners, Augusto Bitter and the Women’s Art Association of Canada.
event_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Home at Spadina Museum
short_description: Discover how homes shape identity through the Austin family story and contemporary art at Spadina Museum. Reimagine hist
short_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Home at Spadina Museum

event_description: Explore the majestic gothic architecture and picturesque tree-lined paths of the campus as we uncover its eerie history and spine-chilling ghostly tales. As we stroll through the historic grounds, our expert guides will captivate you with chilling stories of ghostly sightings and supernatural phenomena witnessed by students, faculty, and visitors alike. Whether you’re a history buff, a believer in the paranormal, a student or alum, or just looking for a unique and spooky evening experience in Toronto, our Campus Secrets & Spectres ghost tour will leave you with a sense of wonder and intrigue as we reveal the haunted secrets of the University of Toronto’s downtown campus.
event_name: Campus Secrets and Spectres – University of Toronto Ghost Tour
short_description: Explore the majestic gothic architecture and picturesque tree-lined paths of the campus as we uncover its eerie history
short_name: Campus Secrets and Spectres – University of Toronto Ghost To

event_description:
Panel talks with professionals working in the creative industries. Hear from artist, writers and community arts organizations about the landscape and opportunities for young artists.

Featuring: illustrator Wenting Li, designer Kingi Carpenter, Tiger Princess Dance Projects Artistic Director Yvonne Ng, Nia Centre for the Arts Youth Program Manager Ikram Kabadeh, Dr. Matthew Bucemi, Assistant Professor, Book Publishing, Writing Department, York University, spoken word champion Joshua “Scribe” Watkis, award-winning novelist Danielle Younge-Ullman and Jellaby creator, comic artist Kean Soo. Sign up on Eventbrite for a reminder! Refreshments will be provided.
event_name: Careers in the Arts Talks: For youth
short_description: Panel talks with professionals working in the creative industries. Hear from artist, writers and community arts organiza
short_name: Careers in the Arts Talks: For youth

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands, better known today as Flanders, was home to revolutionary artists. 

These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then and to our world today. This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects, medieval, renaissance, baroque paintings, sculptures and more, offering a doorway to art between 1400 to 1700. 

The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks
short_description:
The Southern Netherlands, better known today as Flanders, was home to revolutionary artists. 

These extraordinary paint
short_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Mast

event_description:
Join Anuja Varghese, 2023 Governor General's Literary Award winner, for a discussion of Chrysalis: Stories, her debut collection exploring themes of transformation, belonging, and the intersections of queerness, family, and community. These genre-blending stories follow women of colour on surreal journeys of self-discovery, examining race, power, and sexuality in a blur of the real and unreal. This event will be moderated by Diane Taylor Sexton.

By the Lake Book Club hosts six Tuesday-night events from February to December, featuring Canadian authors. Each in-person event includes readings, discussions, Q&A, book signings, and ASL interpretation. Virtual events are subtitled live and provide online viewing and audio.
event_name: Chrysalis: Stories by Anuja Varghese – By the Lake Book Club
short_description: Join Anuja Varghese, 2023 Governor General's Literary Award winner, for a discussion of Chrysalis: Stories, her debut co
short_name: Chrysalis: Stories by Anuja Varghese – By the Lake Book Club

event_description:
Immerse yourself in the calming experience of textured art.

Connect with like-minded creatives in an inspiring setting. Let your creativity flow and unleash your inner artist in a serene and supportive environment. With a focus on hands-on experimentation and individual expression, this class offers a stimulating experience for both beginners and seasoned artists alike. Bring a companion or come on your own.

All materials provided, including snacks and refreshments. Attendees must be 12 and up to participate. Minor guests require one paying adult to accompany them.
short_description:
Immerse yourself in the calming experience of textured art.

Connect with like-minded creatives in an inspiring setting.

event_description:
Join Scarborough Museum for Halloween-themed fun on weekends in October! Enjoy a warm drink from the museum's kitchens, then join in on family-friendly Halloween-themed crafts, games and activities all month long. Decorate chilling cupcakes, and spark your imagination with paper crafts, a scavenger hunt, and more! 

Community Feature: sample a rotating selection of sweet treats from across the globe, curated by the Scarborough Museum Youth Collective. Try something new or enjoy an old favourite, learn more about the stories behind these sweets, and share your own sweet stories in our community jar! 

Treats will be available first come-first served, while quantities last.
short_description: Join Scarborough Museum for Halloween-themed fun on weekends in October! Enjoy a warm drink from the museum's kitchens,

event_description:
Join us at Canada’s premier coin and banknote show and auction!

Featuring over 50 internationally renowned coin and banknote dealers, representing Canada, United States, and the world of collectable currencies. This is the place to buy, sell, and appraise your coins, banknotes, tokens, medals, militaria, gold and silver. You are sure to find a one-of-a-kind coin or banknote treasures!

Furthermore, enjoy fun workshops for children and collectors.
short_description:
Join us at Canada’s premier coin and banknote show and auction!

Featuring over 50 internationally renowned coin and ban

event_description:
In the chaos of urban life, we often forget to take a moment to breathe. Take in a moment of stillness, as we inviting visitors to stand beneath something that feels alive.

The outdoor installation, made from a suspended grid of copper leaves, reimagines the shelter of a forest canopy with each leaf individually cut and hung to form a floating canopy above. By day, the leaves catch the light and scatter soft shadows across the ground. By night, lighting transforms the installation, casting intricate patterns on surrounding surfaces and shifting the atmosphere of the space entirely. As wind moves through the piece, the leaves gently sway and rustle, adding a subtle layer of sound to the experience.

Responding to its surroundings and shifting with the light, weather and movement of people passing beneath it, this work offers a dynamic and reflective space in the heart of the city. 

Designed by RAW Works, with Roland Rom Colthoff, Suleman Khan, Elmira Yousefi and Aaron Hendershot.
short_description: In the chaos of urban life, we often forget to take a moment to breathe. Take in a moment of stillness, as we inviting v

event_description:
This is our seventh solo exhibition of work by Canadian artist Sarah Anne Johnson.

This journey is presented in two chapters: “Cedar Forest” and “Mountain”. Both series expound on the artist’s “Woodland” series, offering new dimensions and depth to an already impressive body of work. 

“Mountain” offers a quiet, personal reflection on horseback trek through Jasper National Park, while “Cedar Forest” draws viewers into the mesmerizing cedar groves of British Columbia. These series exist in beautiful harmony as a meditation on the natural world, and what it mean means to experience it fully.
event_name: A Mountain and a Forest by Sarah Anne Johnson

The outdoor installation, made from a suspended grid of copper leaves, reimagines the shelter of a forest canopy with each leaf individually cut and hung to form a floating canopy above. By day, the leaves catch the light and scatter soft shadows across the ground. By night, lighting transforms the installation, casting intricate patterns on surrounding surfaces and shifting the atmosphere of the space entirely. As wind moves through the piece, the leaves gently sway and rustle, adding a subtle layer of sound to the experience.

Responding to its surroundings and shifting with the light, weather and movement of people passing beneath it, this work offers a dynamic and reflective space in the heart of the city. 

Designed by RAW Works, with Roland Rom Colthoff, Suleman Khan, Elmira Yousefi and Aaron Hendershot.

event_description:
Join our Storytelling Circle at Montgomery's Inn! 

This Storytelling Circle is a welcoming and relaxing environment designed to make everyone feel safe to share our stories. Participants will gather in a circle to listen to the stories from different oral traditions, as well as share their favourite stories! 

Participants will be guided by our principal storyteller Maria Ordonez, who will invite them to share, create, improvise and retell their own stories. Stories will change according to monthly themes - so there will always be new stories to hear and share! 

This program also takes place during Montgomery's Inn's weekly Farmer's Market.

event_description:
Step into the glow, we're back for the sixth year! 

This year, guests can explore the magic like never before with a brand-new layout that lets you move freely between the immersive light show and Pumpkinville at your own pace. Wander through the illuminated maze of over 1.5 million LED and RGB lights, then pop into a vibrant fall fair featuring all new glowing photo ops, installations, midway rides, carnival games, and over 15,000 pumpkins. With new scenes, dazzling photo moments, and an entirely transformed setup, this is not just a walk, it's an adventure!

Calling all game enthusiasts in Toronto!

Join us for a fun-filled night where we will be playing the social deduction game Werewolf. Whether you're a seasoned player or a newbie, this event is perfect for anyone looking to be social while sharpening their strategic thinking skills. Please remember kindness, respect, and safety for all.

event_description:
Step into the mysterious world of Victorian mourning traditions in this unique hands-on workshop exploring the art of hair jewellery. Held in the evocative setting of Spadina Museum, you'll learn how Victorian’s crafted mementos from human hair, a deeply personal and artistic form of remembrance.
Participants will discover how strands of hair were carefully woven into intricate brooches, rings, and lockets, often worn in memory of lost loved ones. After a brief historical overview and tour of relevant artifacts in the museum’s collection, you'll be guided through the process of creating your own hairwork-inspired keepsake using synthetic hair.
Whether you're a history enthusiast, jewellery maker, or simply curious about the strange and sentimental practices of the past, this workshop offers a rare glimpse into one of the most intimate Victorian traditions.
All materials provided. No prior experience required.
For for ages 12 and up. Youth 12-16 must be accompanied by an adult.
event_name: Memento Mori: Victorian Hair Jewellery Workshop at Spadina Museum

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands, better known today as Flanders, was home to revolutionary artists. 

These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then and to our world today. This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects, medieval, renaissance, baroque paintings, sculptures and more, offering a doorway to art between 1400 to 1700. 

The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks

event_description:
Explore the City of Toronto Archives and discover how history, policy and creativity can intersect. Come for a free workshop introducing you to the fundamentals of archival research and how Toronto’s documentary history—including City by-laws—reflects civic life and decision-making. It offers researchers, artists and curious citizens insight into how historical records can inform creative approaches to civic space and governance.

This workshop connects with Future Perfect by Mia + Eric & Action Hero,⁠ an artwork that reimagines municipal by-laws as poetic prompts for alternative ways of living together. Experience it⁠ as a part of Nuit Blanche and during the extended program period.
short_description: Explore the City of Toronto Archives and discover how history, policy and creativity can intersect. Come for a free work

event_description:
Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.
event_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

event_description:
Discover how homes shape identity through the Austin family story and contemporary art at Spadina Museum. Reimagine history, reframe home.

“Home at Spadina Museum” considers how people are influenced by their home. We look at those who make it a home and those who live in it are shaped by domestic spaces. Through interpretation of the Austin family and into contemporary art, we will analyze what makes a home. Re-Imagining the Historic House Museum: A Workplace for Women. 

Step into “Home at Spadina Museum” and explore how homes are shaped by the people who live and work in them. From the Austin family to contemporary art, discover untold stories of women’s labour, care, and community. Reimagine the historic house as both a home and a workplace.

As you explore the exhibition, we invite you to reflect: "What does home mean to you?"

We are grateful to our community partners, Augusto Bitter and the Women’s Art Association of Canada.
event_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Home at Spadina Museum
short_description: Discover how homes shape identity through the Austin family story and contemporary art at Spadina Museum. Reimagine hist
short_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Home at Spadina Museum

cost_notes: Registration begins on December 11 at 9 a.m.
event_description:
Join Anuja Varghese, 2023 Governor General's Literary Award winner, for a discussion of Chrysalis: Stories, her debut collection exploring themes of transformation, belonging, and the intersections of queerness, family, and community. These genre-blending stories follow women of colour on surreal journeys of self-discovery, examining race, power, and sexuality in a blur of the real and unreal. This event will be moderated by Diane Taylor Sexton.

By the Lake Book Club hosts six Tuesday-night events from February to December, featuring Canadian authors. Each in-person event includes readings, discussions, Q&A, book signings, and ASL interpretation. Virtual events are subtitled live and provide online viewing and audio.
event_name: Chrysalis: Stories by Anuja Varghese – By the Lake Book Club
short_description: Join Anuja Varghese, 2023 Governor General's Literary Award winner, for a discussion of Chrysalis: Stories, her debut co
short_name: Chrysalis: Stories by Anuja Varghese – By the Lake Book Club

event_description:
Our experienced chandler will teach you the basics of candle making, including the benefits of using soy wax, and the step-by-step process to create beautiful custom candles.

Select your scent from a variety of delightful, premium fragrances and essential oils to personalize your candles. 

All materials provided, including snacks and refreshments.

This workshop is great for beginners and candle enthusiasts alike. Come on your own or with friends. No experience needed. Guests must be ages 12 and up to participate.

event_description: Your weekly destination for local shopping and community vibes inside the historic Parkdale Hall. The market features a curated mix of fresh produce, artisan goods, handmade crafts, and vintage finds from Toronto’s most creative small businesses. With new vendors each week and seasonal surprises throughout the year, there’s always something fresh to discover. Pet-friendly, and open year-round!

event_description:
Curated by Yantong Li, a Master of Visual Studies Curatorial Studies graduate student. 

Featured artists Kent Chan, Alvin Luong, and Solveig Qu Suess interrogate the way we currently consume media about environmental precarity, inviting viewers to engage in a dialogue and sit with representations of catastrophe that deemphasize the spectacular and dramatic. 

Dwelling Under Distant Suns highlights the struggle to make visible the increasingly unpredictable landscape of the climate crisis and other human-led impacts on the environment. Using speculative storytelling and myth-making through film-based works, this exhibition brings a sense of immediacy to our planet’s growing climate crisis and the environmental dangers that feel distant or out of sight.
event_name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto: Dwelling Under Distant Suns

Dwelling Under Distant Suns highlights the struggle to make visible the increasingly unpredictable landscape of the climate crisis and other human-led impacts on the environment. Using speculative storytelling and myth-making through film-based works, this exhibition brings a sense of immediacy to our planet’s growing climate crisis and the environmental dangers that feel distant or out of sight.
event_name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto: Dwelling Under Distant Suns

Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.

event_description:
Calling all Swifties! A brand new, one-of-a-kind escape room experience is opening its doors, and it’s “Taylor”-made for fans of Taylor Swift. Blending the thrill of classic escape challenges with trivia and Easter eggs from Taylor's iconic career, this immersive adventure offers something completely unique — and something secret too.

The Swiftie Session invites groups to step into a world where puzzles meet pop culture. Solve clues rooted in Taylor’s lyrics, albums, and eras as you race against the clock to “Shake It Off” and break free!

The experience doesn’t stop at the final lock. We’re offering an exclusive bundle package for groups to extend the fun with a private karaoke party room, featuring, sing-alongs to Taylor’s new album, props & photo ops and friendship bracelet workshops.

event_description:
This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

Through dozens of interactives and life-sized models, including a life-size head of the huge extinct Megalodon, join us for a unique look at these magnificent creatures, their habitats, hunting techniques, and the conservation threats that they face.

event_description: Enjoy a day of music, adventure, and education. Join us for the Ravine Festival, an exciting day of fun and learning set against the beautiful backdrop of the Toronto Botanical Garden and its surrounding natural spaces. Discover fascinating facts about ravines, local wildlife, and how you can contribute to the preservation of Toronto’s ravine systems. This is a fantastic opportunity for families to get hands-on with nature and environmental stewardship.

event_description:
Step back in time with a free visit to Spadina Museum, beautifully decorated for a 1920s Christmas. Visitors can enjoy the opulent holiday décor and period ambiance that once filled the home of the wealthy Austin family. Twinkling lights, antique ornaments, and rooms set for a classic Jazz Age celebration bring the spirit of the season to life.
As you stroll through the mansion, interpretive displays offer insights into the lavish holiday traditions of Toronto’s elite in the 1920s. In contrast, visitors will also learn about the experiences of the city’s less fortunate citizens during the same era—those who faced poverty, unemployment, and food insecurity during a time of great social and economic change.
From a grand dining room prepared for a festive feast to modest depictions of how the servants of the household marked the holidays, the experience paints a full picture of a Toronto Christmas in the early 20th century.
event_name: Jazz Age Christmas at Spadina Museum
short_description: Step back in time with a free visit to Spadina Museum, beautifully decorated for a 1920s Christmas. Visitors can enjoy t
short_name: Jazz Age Christmas at Spadina Museum

event_description:
Fall migration is underway! Bring your travel mug to the Centre for Urban Ecology and fill up with some bird-friendly coffee from Birds and Beans before heading out on a morning bird walk with a Humber Arboretum Nature Interpreter. 

This event is part of City of Toronto Ravine Days and in honour of World Migratory Bird Day on Saturday October 11. 

   
When: Thursday October 9, 9:00 AM 
Where: Meet at the Centre for Urban Ecology (the glass building with the red door on the Humber Arboretum grounds). Found at the back of Humber Polytechnic North Campus (205 Humber College Blvd - Directions). 
Who: Open to all 
How: Free. Just bring your mug and show up!

*For those coming from off-campus, please note that picket lines in support of the current strike by Full-time Support Staff at Ontario Colleges will delay entrance for those coming by car; public transit options are stopping on the street in front of the campus.
event_name: Beaks and Brews: Morning Birds and Coffee at the Humber Arboretum

short_name: Beaks and Brews: Morning Birds and Coffee at the Humber Arbo

event_description:
A reimagining of the classic album by RnB legend Chaka Khan and Chick Corea featuring the original drummer and Koerner Hall favourite, Lisa Fischer.

Echoes of an Era was a stunning jazz album released in 1982, featuring Chaka Khan, Chick Corea, Freddie Hubbard, Joe Henderson, Stanley Clarke, and Lenny White. With timeless standards like “All of Me,” “I Hear Music,” and “I Loves You, Porgy,” this project showcased Chaka’s incredible versatility as a vocalist and earned her a Grammy nomination in the jazz category.

After the concert, enjoy a beverage and more music!
event_name: Echoes of an Era featuring Lisa Fischer, Eddie Henderson, Javon Jackson, Orrin Evans, John Patitucci

Welcome to Le Dolci’s exclusive 5-day Parisian Baking Series: Desserts from Paris! Perfect for beginners, this hands-on course runs 5 hours daily (plus a 30-minute lunch) and teaches the art of French pastry.

Day 1: Master fruit and chocolate tarts.
Day 2: Create flaky croissants and pain au chocolat.
Day 3: Learn enriched doughs like brioche and babka.
Day 4: Pipe and fill éclairs and cream puffs with choux pastry.
Day 5: Perfect macarons and soufflés.

Guided by expert chefs, you'll gain practical skills and pastry theory. Join us and bring the sweet taste of Paris to life!

We are thrilled to welcome back Grammy Award-winning pianist Michelle Cann! 

Since her debut with us in 2022, she has been named the inaugural Christel DeHaan Artistic Partner of the American Pianists Association and received the Sphinx Medal of Excellence. She continues to captivate audiences with her passionate interpretations and compelling presence on stage.

This program explores the intertwined lives and works of Clara Schumann, Robert Schumann and Johannes Brahms - three composers whose deep artistic and personal connections shaped the Romantic era.

event_description:
This is our seventh solo exhibition of work by Canadian artist Sarah Anne Johnson.

This journey is presented in two chapters: “Cedar Forest” and “Mountain”. Both series expound on the artist’s “Woodland” series, offering new dimensions and depth to an already impressive body of work. 

“Mountain” offers a quiet, personal reflection on horseback trek through Jasper National Park, while “Cedar Forest” draws viewers into the mesmerizing cedar groves of British Columbia. These series exist in beautiful harmony as a meditation on the natural world, and what it mean means to experience it fully.
event_name: A Mountain and a Forest by Sarah Anne Johnson

event_description:
Curated by Manar Abo Touk, this is a multidisciplinary group exhibition that reimagines the gallery as a living garden, a shared space of care, restoration, and quiet resistance.

Bringing together artists who work with natural, digital, and tactile materials to navigate experiences of displacement, intergenerational grief, and mental health.

Informed by diasporic, feminist, and ecological perspectives, the exhibition explores themes of collective tending, healing practices, and the everyday rituals that sustain us.
event_name: Being Scene 2025 Curated Exhibition: Tending to What Remains
short_description: Curated by Manar Abo Touk, this is a multidisciplinary group exhibition that reimagines the gallery as a living garden,
short_name: Being Scene 2025 Curated Exhibition: Tending to What Remains

event_description:
Join us on a chilling and thrilling journey through the dark history of the city as we delve into the world of ghosts, graveyards, hangings, and haunts.

 Prepare to be captivated by spine-tingling ghost stories about haunted theatres, unsolved mysteries, secrets hiding in plain sight, and spooky historic buildings. Our outdoor tour will take you on a hair-raising paranormal adventure, departing from the courtyard in front of the Hockey Hall of Fame. 

Get ready to see the city in a whole new light, or rather, darkness, as you uncover the eerie and supernatural tales that lurk in its shadows.

event_description:
Hailed by CBC Music as one of Canada’s finest young musicians, pianist Tony Yike Yang first rose to international acclaim at the age of 16 after becoming the youngest-ever Laureate in the history of the International Chopin Piano Competition in Warsaw, winning the 5th prize in 2015. 

An alumnus of The Taylor Academy, he has also performed for dozens of royalty, dignitaries, and ambassadors such as HRH Camilla, the Queen Consort of the United Kingdom, HRH Queen Mathilde of Belgium, former Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper, former Kuwaiti Prime Minister Sheikh Nasser Al-Sabah, and Polish President Andrzej Duda, among others.

The Chopin Courier notes he is “…an absolute revelation…he combines the characteristics of a true virtuoso and an artist.” 

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
event_name: Tony Yike Yang celebrates Lunar New Year
short_description: Hailed by CBC Music as one of Canada’s finest young musicians, pianist Tony Yike Yang first rose to international acclai
short_name: Tony Yike Yang celebrates Lunar New Year

Discover Hyunsun Park's captivating collection of gouache paintings that evoke empathy and connection. Each painting is a window into personal and shared experiences-- stories of survival, resilience, and the search for meaning.

Join the Artists for the opening reception on Saturday, August 9, 2 to 4 p.m. Light refreshments provided.

event_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reunites to pre-game their twentieth high school reunion, but nostalgia quickly turns into something darker. 

As drinks flow and old wounds resurface, they confront the choices that shaped them, the friendships that endured or crumbled, and the presence of something, or someone they can’t escape. 

Sharp, theatrical, and deeply moving, this is a reckoning for elder millennials, caught between who they were, who they’ve become, and the world they never saw coming. When the night ends, will they still recognize themselves?
short_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reun

event_description:
Kishi Bashi is the moniker of singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist Kaoru Ishibashi. 

A virtuoso violinist and Berklee College of Music alumnus, he has toured with renowned artists such as Regina Spektor and of Montreal before embarking on a critically acclaimed solo career. His 2012 debut album, 151a, was described as “a radiant, uplifting soundscape” by NPR and launched him onto major festival stages, including SXSW and Austin City Limits.
short_description:
Kishi Bashi is the moniker of singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist Kaoru Ishibashi.

event_description:
The rhythm section of Wayne Shorter’s legendary quartet kick off the night and joings a local Toronto big band for the premiere of Pérez’s new work, co-commissioned by the Royal Conservatory of Music.

As a solo artist and as a collaborator with jazz giants from Dizzy Gillespie to Wayne Shorter, for over three decades, Grammy-winning Panamanian pianist-composer Danilo Pérez has been lauded as one of the most creative forces in contemporary music. With jazz as the anchoring foundation, Pérez’s global jazz music is a blend of Panamanian roots, Latin American folk music, West African rhythms, and European impressionism, promoting music as a borderless and multidimensional bridge between all people.

After the concert, enjoy a beverage and more music at the Postlude Performance in the Leslie and Anna Dan Galleria.
event_name: Danilo Pérez, John Patitucci, and Brian Blade
short_description: The rhythm section of Wayne Shorter’s legendary quartet kick off the night and joings a local Toronto big band for the p
short_name: Danilo Pérez, John Patitucci, and Brian Blade

event_description:
Beginning July 1st at Scarborough Museum, experience Washed Up by Hatecopy. The project captures the essence of liminal spaces that serve as cultural hubs for the South Asian immigrant communities, using the washing machine as a vessel to carry textiles that signify our roots and drawing visitors into an environment that intertwines the past, present, and future; acknowledging the dirty laundry of Canadian History and “Truth,” and reclaiming both seen and unseen spaces.

Maria Qamar (b. 1991) is a Toronto-based pop artist whose work is focused in the South Asian diaspora and immigrant communities and their cultural experiences. The work specializes in themes regarding feminism, social change, humour, pop culture, politics and romance. The artist has been recognized both nationally and internationally with exhibits and features in the Museum of Contemporary Arts, the National Arts Centre, Sotheby’s, Phillips Auction, and the AGO.
event_name: Washed Up: Pop-Up Installation at Scarborough Museum
short_description: Beginning July 1st at Scarborough Museum, experience Washed Up by Hatecopy. The project captures the essence of liminal
short_name: Washed Up: Pop-Up Installation at Scarborough Museum

The work specializes in themes regarding feminism, social change, humour, pop culture, politics and romance. The artist has been recognized both nationally and internationally with exhibits and features in the Museum of Contemporary Arts, the National Arts Centre, Sotheby’s, Phillips Auction, and the AGO.
event_name: Washed Up: Pop-Up Installation at Scarborough Museum

Wyrmwell Studios showcases emerging Toronto artists Shevon Lewis, Kima Lenaghan, Amy Thomson, and Misbah Ahmed. Explore their illustrations, transformative portraiture, and sculptural ceramics. 

Join the Artists for the opening reception on Saturday, November 1, 2 to 4 p.m. Light refreshments provided.

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands, better known today as Flanders, was home to revolutionary artists. 

These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then and to our world today. This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects, medieval, renaissance, baroque paintings, sculptures and more, offering a doorway to art between 1400 to 1700. 

The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks

event_description:
Celebrate the holiday season with Juno Award-winning artist Loreena McKennitt and her enchanting Under A Winter’s Moon concert, a live performance of carols and tales blends Celtic, Indigenous, and Welsh cultures.

The show also includes Gemini Award-winning actor Cedric Smith narrating the magical A Child’s Christmas in Wales and begins with Ojibway artist Christin Dennis, also known as Gzhiiquot/Fast Moving Cloud, presenting the story of Skywoman. Prepare to be transported to a world of music and spoken word that connects with our past and awakens the spirit of the season.

Loreena McKennitt’s eclectic Celtic blend of pop, folk, and world music has sold over 14 million albums worldwide. Her recordings have achieved Gold, Platinum, and multi-Platinum status in 15 countries on four continents. In 2004, McKennitt was awarded the Order of Canada and in 2013 was appointed Knight of the National Order of Arts and Letters of the Republic of France.
event_name: Loreena McKennitt: Under A Winter’s Moon I
short_description: Celebrate the holiday season with Juno Award-winning artist Loreena McKennitt and her enchanting Under A Winter’s Moon c
short_name: Loreena McKennitt: Under A Winter’s Moon I

event_description:
A renowned Korean-Canadian cellist and conductor, currently Music Director of the Ann Arbor Symphony. He also served as assistant conductor of the Boston Symphony, resident conductor of the Toronto Symphony Orchestra, and associate conductor of the Pittsburgh Symphony. He is the 2022 recipient of The Sir Georg Solti Conducting Award.

The Temerty Orchestral Program at The Glenn Gould School, the Royal Conservatory Orchestra is widely regarded as an outstanding ensemble and one of the best training orchestras in North America, with graduates having joined the ranks of the greatest orchestras in the world.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
event_name: Royal Conservatory Orchestra with Conductor Earl Lee
short_description: A renowned Korean-Canadian cellist and conductor, currently Music Director of the Ann Arbor Symphony. He also served as
short_name: Royal Conservatory Orchestra with Conductor Earl Lee

event_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reunites to pre-game their twentieth high school reunion, but nostalgia quickly turns into something darker. 

As drinks flow and old wounds resurface, they confront the choices that shaped them, the friendships that endured or crumbled, and the presence of something, or someone they can’t escape. 

Sharp, theatrical, and deeply moving, this is a reckoning for elder millennials, caught between who they were, who they’ve become, and the world they never saw coming. When the night ends, will they still recognize themselves?

event_description:
Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and perspectives forming a kind of visual and sonic cacophony. It’s a nod to global (or even galactic) unity, and to the idea that despite all the noise and division, we’re more alike than not. 

In her Canadian debut, Intergalactic Planetary brings together imagery and works inspired by cities including Shanghai, Chongqing, Berlin, Tokyo, Bangkok and locations across the United States. Snelling explains, “Through this work, I ask: how can we move beyond our fears, borders, and egos to become more humane? Perhaps by staying curious, open, and willing to see each other more fully, we can take a small step toward connection, and even a glimmer of peace for the future”.

Join us on Nuit Blanche to view the exhibition's works, while DJ beats set the mood with dynamic sounds and enjoy two exhibition-inspired cocktails-one coffee-based and the other with an intergalactic twist.
short_description: Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and p

event_description:
Curated by Yantong Li, a Master of Visual Studies Curatorial Studies graduate student. 

Featured artists Kent Chan, Alvin Luong, and Solveig Qu Suess interrogate the way we currently consume media about environmental precarity, inviting viewers to engage in a dialogue and sit with representations of catastrophe that deemphasize the spectacular and dramatic. 

Dwelling Under Distant Suns highlights the struggle to make visible the increasingly unpredictable landscape of the climate crisis and other human-led impacts on the environment. Using speculative storytelling and myth-making through film-based works, this exhibition brings a sense of immediacy to our planet’s growing climate crisis and the environmental dangers that feel distant or out of sight.
event_name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto: Dwelling Under Distant Suns
short_description:
Curated by Yantong Li, a Master of Visual Studies Curatorial Studies graduate student.

short_name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto: Dwelling Under Dist

event_description:
Join Scarborough Museum and Veneise George for a two-part celebration of the way food and stories intertwine during the holidays!

In Part 1, participants will gather for a story-sharing circle, getting to know one another and presenting a recipe that connects them to a feeling of home during the holiday season. In Part 2, these recipes and stories will form a communal potluck-style meal! All are welcome for this family-friendly gathering. 

Veneise George is a wife, proud mom of two, entrepreneur, and the passionate force behind YAWDI'S—a premium condiment brand rooted in bold Caribbean flavors, cultural heritage, and handcrafted quality.

This workshop is part of Scarborough Museum's Season of Celebration - a series of family-friendly activities that celebrate light, love, and joy through food, culture, and storytelling.
event_name: Holiday Food & Story Sharing Circle at Scarborough Museum

short_name: Holiday Food & Story Sharing Circle at Scarborough Museum

event_description:
A songwriter with a fine-tuned ear for warm, wool-sweater melodies, richly rendered narratives, and intimate autumnal ambiance, like Jeff Buckley time warped into Bon Iver’s wood cabin. 

His debut 2016 album, "Safety" pegged Luca as an indie-folk phenom on the rise, with streaming stats well into the seven figures. With his JUNO-nominated 2020 follow-up, "Nothing Is Lost", Luca graduated from the proverbial coffeehouse to the concert hall, recasting his private conversations as cinematic set pieces.
short_description: A songwriter with a fine-tuned ear for warm, wool-sweater melodies, richly rendered narratives, and intimate autumnal am

event_description:
Join Elavarasi Janakiraman and Scarborough Museum for family-friendly, hands-on henna workshops this November! Learn more about the artform, and adorn your hands with traditional henna designs that honour intergenerational artistry and cultural expression. 

Elavarasi Janakiraman of Lotus Henna Scarborough is a passionate henna artist rooted in the Scarborough community. Her love for henna began in childhood, when she would decorate her own hands with intricate designs. What started as a personal art form shared with friends and family has since blossomed into a full-time career. Today, she offers her beautiful henna services across Scarborough and the Greater Toronto Area. 

This workshop is part of Scarborough Museum's Season of Celebration - a series of family-friendly activities that celebrate light, love, and joy through food, culture, and storytelling.
short_description: Join Elavarasi Janakiraman and Scarborough Museum for family-friendly, hands-on henna workshops this November! Learn mor

event_description:
This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

Through dozens of interactives and life-sized models, including a life-size head of the huge extinct Megalodon, join us for a unique look at these magnificent creatures, their habitats, hunting techniques, and the conservation threats that they face.
short_description: This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding di
