event_description:
The Southern Netherlands — better known today as Flanders — was home to revolutionary artists. These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then - and to our world today. 

This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects — medieval, Renaissance, and baroque paintings, sculptures and more — offers a doorway into the Southern Netherlands of 1400 to 1700. The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks
short_description: The Southern Netherlands — better known today as Flanders — was home to revolutionary artists. These extraordinary paint
short_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Mast

event_description:
Join our community event in honour of the thousands of Chinese Railroad Workers who came to Canada in the late 1800s to help build the Canadian Pacific Railway. 

The event will include speeches by community leaders and dignitaries, traditional lion dance by the Northern Legs and Southern Fists Kung Fu Club, and music by the Ontario Chinese Seniors Association Choir and Orchestra.

event_description:
Presented by: Toronto Field Naturalists

Enjoy this nature walk through Cottonwoods Flats, a restored meadow along the Don River. Hear about the history of the area, the ongoing restoration stewardship, and the multi-year citizen science monitoring project. Cottonwoods Flats was in the news in September due to the damage caused there from illegal raves over the summer. Come out and learn why this area needs protecting. 

The walk will be led by Toronto Field Naturalists' president Lynn Miller.
short_description:
Presented by: Toronto Field Naturalists

Enjoy this nature walk through Cottonwoods Flats, a restored meadow along the D

event_description:
The must-see event of the Halloween season is back! From the creators of the sold-out sensation, Tales of the Grotesque (2023 - 2024), comes a new anthology of gothic horror. Experience what critics call a “devilish delight!” With fresh characters, familiar tales, and unique terrors, we bring literature’s most depraved characters to life… and death.

After a lady of the night is murdered, a mad doctor strikes a pact with the Devil to raise her from the dead. But when he comes face-to-face with her killer at a masquerade, all hell breaks loose. Descend into madness with Victor Frankenstein, Henry Jekyll, and Dorian Gray as they discover the consequences of playing God and the monstrous repercussions when the Devil comes to collect. 

An immersive horror opera set within the oldest surviving building from the Town of York, we invite you to explore Victorian Toronto through the eyes of history’s most disturbed authors, though it might just cost your soul.
short_description: The must-see event of the Halloween season is back! From the creators of the sold-out sensation, Tales of the Grotesque

event_description:
Step into a retro music video playground, with wall-to-wall visuals, nostalgic cocktails and the throwback anthems you forgot you remembered. 

From giant Tamagotchis and Game Boy backdrops to Britney, Usher, and Bon Jovi lighting up the walls, it’s your favourite club hits minus the sticky floors and late-night cab ride. Think less nightclub, more time machine: dance, sing, and still be home by 11.

event_description:
Celebrating 21 years as a full-time songwriter and performing artist, Miss Emily returns for the unveiling of her new album, "The Medicine". 

Produced by Grammy and JUNO Award winner Colin Linden, The Medicine will be released on streaming platforms or in stores on November 7,  but attendees of this show will have exclusive early access to purchase the CD and vinyl and listen to the album in full.

Prince Edward County, Canada-born Miss Emily specializes in overcoming insurmountable challenges. With an innovative spirit born out of necessity, her incomparable vocals are matched only by her electrifying, roof-rattling performances.
event_name: Official Unveiling of New Miss Emily Album – The Medicine

short_name: Official Unveiling of New Miss Emily Album – The Medicine

event_description: A brand-new comedy show clocking in to roast the unrelenting day-to-day grind. From incompetent managers and weird co-workers to impossible customers and inboxes that are like an all-you-can-eat buffet of stupidity, no job is safe. Whether you’re hustling in the gig economy, surviving the 9-to-5, or just trying to make it through one more Zoom call without consuming a vat of medical-grade caffeine, The Second City’s cast of comedic professionals are here working overtime with their world-famous brand of sketch and improv comedy. Don’t call in sick… you’ll want to be here for this shift.

event_description:
Let the WILD Rumpus Begin!

Hot on the heels of last year’s sold-out sensation, Max and the Wild Things roar back to the YPT stage. Embark on a magical interactive journey as you help transform Max’s bedroom into the legendary land of the Wild Things! Crowned their king, Max faces a big decision: rule the rumpus or return home? Based on Maurice Sendak’s beloved storybook, this adaptation is an interactive experience. 

Audience members will be seated around the performance area on three large mats, with limited chairs provided at the back for grownups who may require a seat.

Audience members will be seated around the performance area on three large mats, with limited chairs provided at the back for grownups who may require a seat.

event_description: A brand-new comedy show clocking in to roast the unrelenting day-to-day grind. From incompetent managers and weird co-workers to impossible customers and inboxes that are like an all-you-can-eat buffet of stupidity, no job is safe. Whether you’re hustling in the gig economy, surviving the 9-to-5, or just trying to make it through one more Zoom call without consuming a vat of medical-grade caffeine, The Second City’s cast of comedic professionals are here working overtime with their world-famous brand of sketch and improv comedy. Don’t call in sick… you’ll want to be here for this shift.

event_description:
A special treat! Eric has created a program for clarinet and string quartet, featuring four of his Toronto Symphony Orchestra (TSO) colleagues. 

He has been TSO’s principal clarinet since 2021. A Montreal native, he was named CBC Next! artist in 2013, Vandoren Emerging Artist of the year in 2017, and was a Sylva Gelber Career Grant recipient in 2016. 

Eric has been featured as a soloist with numerous orchestras including the l’Orchestre symphonique de Québec, and the NAC Orchestra. Joining Eric are his colleagues Luri Lee and Kun Yan on violins, Rémi Pelletier on viola, and Lucia Ticho on cello. 

The program will feature Gershwin, Bartok, Ravel clarinet arrangements along with the virtuosic von Weber Clarinet Quintet in B-flat Major, Op. 34.
event_name: Eric Abramovitz, clarinet with TSO Strings
short_description: A special treat! Eric has created a program for clarinet and string quartet, featuring four of his Toronto Symphony Orch
short_name: Eric Abramovitz, clarinet with TSO Strings

cost_notes: Please visit website for ticket prices for special events.
event_description:
This is a contemporary form of environmental art created by artists who are  concerned about reducing waste, recycling, and making the world a better place, while raising awareness about environmental changes.

 It aims to showcases the beauty and creativity of using recycled, environmentally friendly or sustainable materials to create phenomenal artwork, using water-based paints, natural pigments and recycled materials to name a few elements. lt is art that advocates for the planet, catering to all ages and present in various mediums, including paintings, sculptures or fashion.

Presenting our second annual art exhibition, we will be utilizing selected artists to mentor African and Caribbean communities on the positioning of multicultural history and art within the Canadian cultural landscape.
short_description: This is a contemporary form of environmental art created by artists who are  concerned about reducing waste, recycling,

event_description:
As night falls, we’ll set out on a lantern-lit stroll along the cobblestone streets of the historic Distillery District, one of Toronto’s most haunted spots! 

Learn about the tragic events that left their mark and hear spine-chilling tales of paranormal encounters from this iconic area. Feel the goosebumps rise as you explore the narrow alleyways and hidden corners where spirits are said to lurk. 

Whether you’re a history buff, a ghost enthusiast, or just looking for a unique experience, this outdoor tour is sure to captivate your imagination. Get ready to experience the thrills and chills like never before.
event_name: Spirits of the Distillery District Ghost Tour
short_description: As night falls, we’ll set out on a lantern-lit stroll along the cobblestone streets of the historic Distillery District,
short_name: Spirits of the Distillery District Ghost Tour

event_description:
Join our community event in honour of the thousands of Chinese Railroad Workers who came to Canada in the late 1800s to help build the Canadian Pacific Railway. 

The event will include speeches by community leaders and dignitaries, traditional lion dance by the Northern Legs and Southern Fists Kung Fu Club, and music by the Ontario Chinese Seniors Association Choir and Orchestra.
event_name: Annual Wreath Laying Ceremony in Honour of the Chinese Railroad Workers of Canada
short_description: Join our community event in honour of the thousands of Chinese Railroad Workers who came to Canada in the late 1800s to
short_name: Annual Wreath Laying Ceremony in Honour of the Chinese Railr

event_description:
Let’s create with introduced species.

Learn how to make pens out of Garlic Mustard, Buckthorn ink, twist cord, and sketch, as we discover the gifts of these abundant plants. This is a great opportunity for beginners who always wanted to learn sketching techniques with handmade inks, as well as people who want to build on their existing skills and use plants in their artmaking practices.

Hosted by Alex Iorgu is an Etobicoke land-based artist. She has been learning from nature how to create, grow and let go. In her current art practice, she is developing Grounded Sculptures, a series of site-specific ephemeral installations using natural materials and found clay. Exhibiting themes of transformation and endurance, the sculptures will deconstruct, eventually disappearing. Alex’s belief in the power of making and creating is often executed in the context of community where she has received multiple grants to support projects across many divers
short_description:
Let’s create with introduced species.

Learn how to make pens out of Garlic Mustard, Buckthorn ink, twist cord, and sket

event_description:
Winner of the prestigious International Menuhin Violin Competition, Kerson Leong has been described as “not just one of Canada’s greatest violinists but one of the greatest violinists, period”. 

He has performed with Brussels, Oslo, Royal Philharmonic and Istanbul, Singapore, Toronto, Wuppertal and Montréal Symphony Orchestras. As a sought-after soloist, Kerson has appeared at Carnegie and Wigmore Halls, Auditorium du Louvre, and National Center for the Performing Arts, Beijing. 

He plays the ‘ex Bohrer, Baumgartner’ Guarneri del Gesu violin courtesy of Canimex Inc. Drummondville.

His virtuosic recital includes violin works by Ysaÿe (Sonata No. 3 “Ballade” & Sonata No. 4 in E minor), Kreisler’s Recitativo and Scherzo, and Bach’s Chaconne from Partita No. 2.

event_description:
Curated by Yantong Li, a Master of Visual Studies Curatorial Studies graduate student. 

Featured artists Kent Chan, Alvin Luong, and Solveig Qu Suess interrogate the way we currently consume media about environmental precarity, inviting viewers to engage in a dialogue and sit with representations of catastrophe that deemphasize the spectacular and dramatic. 

Dwelling Under Distant Suns highlights the struggle to make visible the increasingly unpredictable landscape of the climate crisis and other human-led impacts on the environment. Using speculative storytelling and myth-making through film-based works, this exhibition brings a sense of immediacy to our planet’s growing climate crisis and the environmental dangers that feel distant or out of sight.
event_name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto: Dwelling Under Distant Suns

event_description:
Back for the sixth year! 

Enjoy can’t-miss comedy with over 20 comics from across Toronto and beyond. Shows include Andrew Phung and Friends, Not Hamilton Improvised, Nkasi Ogbonnah’s Afronaut, and more. 

New this year, enjoy "Our Cities On Our Stages", Bad Dog Theatre’s groundbreaking symposium on inclusion and diversity. This full day of activities will dovetail into an improv presentation.

event_description:
This is our seventh solo exhibition of work by Canadian artist Sarah Anne Johnson.

This journey is presented in two chapters: “Cedar Forest” and “Mountain”. Both series expound on the artist’s “Woodland” series, offering new dimensions and depth to an already impressive body of work. 

“Mountain” offers a quiet, personal reflection on horseback trek through Jasper National Park, while “Cedar Forest” draws viewers into the mesmerizing cedar groves of British Columbia. These series exist in beautiful harmony as a meditation on the natural world, and what it mean means to experience it fully.
event_name: A Mountain and a Forest by Sarah Anne Johnson

event_description:
In this new solo work, Laurence Lemieux explores how lineage and the sentiment of belonging has affected her behaviour. 

Anne, is one of Laurence’s ancestors and the starting point of this exploration. The choreographic score draws on these findings, building a structure around individual power and belonging. 

The performance space is designed by senior artist, Edward Poitras, supported by an original composition by Aidan McConnell, lighting design by Nic Vincent, and rehearsal direction by Danielle Baskerville.
short_description: In this new solo work, Laurence Lemieux explores how lineage and the sentiment of belonging has affected her behaviour.

event_description:
This fall, immerse yourself with a bold collection of abstract works reflecting the beauty in disorder and inspired by the transformation of the autumn season.

Celebrate the season’s unpredictable rhythms with live art, refreshments, and a chance to meet the artists. Don’t miss the opportunity to experience the in-between where colours collide, textures evolve and emotions spills across the canvas.

event_description:
Created by Kenton Blythe and Lisa Cormier, this award-winning production (Patron’s Pick at Toronto Fringe, Best Theatre for Young Audiences and Broadwayworld.com) explores the time before the dinosaurs. 

It's the perfect musical adventure for the whole family!

event_description:
A quiet lake in Ontario is making a lot of noise.

Sediments from the bottom of a small lake in Ontario are revealing a remarkable record of our impact on the planet.

Just outside Toronto, Ontario lies Crawford Lake, a significant site offering a unique, comprehensive 1,000-year record of human impacts - local, regional, and global.

event_description:
A quiet lake in Ontario is making a lot of noise.

Sediments from the bottom of a small lake in Ontario are revealing a remarkable record of our impact on the planet.

Just outside Toronto, Ontario lies Crawford Lake, a significant site offering a unique, comprehensive 1,000-year record of human impacts - local, regional, and global.

event_description:
The Toronto Music Garden will be transformed into a celebration of sound and light during a series of free live performances featuring Land of Talk, Sean Jones, Soulpepper Academy, Begonia, Amanda Rheaume, The North Sound, Charlotte Cornfield, Tanika Charles and The Recipee Band complemented by glowing interactive lights.

Bring a blanket or lawn chair, settle in by the water, and take in the magic of music, lights and community at the waterfront.

Part of Water/Fall Festival.
short_description: The Toronto Music Garden will be transformed into a celebration of sound and light during a series of free live performa

event_description:
This family-friendly exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

Through dozens of interactives and life-sized models, including a life-size head of the huge extinct Megalodon, join us for a unique look at these magnificent creatures, their habitats, hunting techniques, and the conservation threats that they face.

event_description:
Photography omes alive with dance, music, and spoken word performances. Nine photographic artists join together with professionals in the fields of dance, poetry, drama, and music to present an afternoon of visual art with Ekphrasis performances in response to the photographs. 

Photographic artists are Linda Briskin, Brianna Caryll, Lucie Collins, Martha Davis, Vivian East, Kye Marshall, Jana Skarecky, Patricia Stamp, and Henrietta Walmark.

Performers responding to the visual works are dancer Brianna Clarke, musicians Taivi Alexander, Kye Marshall and Jana Skarecky, dramatists Angie Littlefield and Annie Rosenberg and poets Kate Marshall Flaherty, Bianca Lakoseljac, JC Sulzenko and Donna Wootton.

Hidden throughout our miniature world are spooky little Halloween scenes, each with a letter next to it. Collect all the letters, unscramble the riddle and unlock the final phrase. It’s an adventure full of tiny chills, big thrills and mysterious fun for everyone.

Are you ready to begin the hunt?

event_description:
JUNO award winning singer-songwriter-musician Cara Luft is that rare artist steeped in folk and traditional roots music almost from birth, yet willing to alter the fabric, stretch the boundaries and fearlessly bend genres and styles.  

A founding member of Canadianfolk super-group The Wailin' Jennys and the brainchild behind Winnipeg's acclaimed powerhouse duo The Small Glories, Luft deserves her solid reputation as one of
Canada’s finest live performers, armed with amazing tenacity, vision, energy and a contagious hilarity.

To quote the roots magazine No Depression, “Luft has a rich tradition in folk music – it’s safe to assume that she knows her stuff – and upon listening it becomes quite clear that she is indeed a formidable songwriter and performer... [The] lovely Ms. Luft sets the bar for the talented few who’ll follow in her footsteps.”
short_description: JUNO award winning singer-songwriter-musician Cara Luft is that rare artist steeped in folk and traditional roots music

event_description:
This pop-up installation explores the compelling stories and experiences of Toronto’s diverse communities who have fought for their sense of home, belonging and identity during periods of conflict and peace. 

This installation is created in partnership with the Toronto Metropolitan University's Masters of Digital Media program.
event_name: Echoes of Home: Pop-Up Exhibit at Fort York

event_description:
Enjoy a series of celebrations in honour of this Canadian legend's centennial birthday.

Celebration starts with a nod to Peterson’s 1977 release, Oscar and the Bassists, featuring Christian McBride, John Clayton, and others, with Benny Green on piano, and Jeff Hamilton on drums, along with a performance of his AFRICA! Suite featuring the Clayton-Hamilton Jazz Orchestra, Green, and McBride, and hosted by The Honourable Justice Rosalie Abella. 

Hear Oscar’s solo compositions played by an all-star lineup of pianists: Makoto Ozone, Jon Kimura Parker, and Thompson Egbo-Egbo. Tune in to renowned jazz vocalist Cécile McLorin Salvant and her trio perform Oscar’s song.

Partake in masterclasses, talks, and performances by students from the RCM’s Oscar Peterson School of Music. 

Curated by Kelly Peterson and Mervon Mehta.

event_description:
Two internationally acclaimed  experiences, SÉANCE and FLIGHT, are coming. 

Staged inside purpose-built 40-foot shipping containers, these genre-defying works use complete darkness, 360° binaural audio, and precisely timed physical and environmental effects to create psychologically charged alternate realities.

The Toronto season brings two of the company’s most toured experiences to Canada for the first time. With over 700,000 attendees worldwide and appearances of their work at Venice Film Festival, Tribeca, SXSW, and Edinburgh Fringe, Toronto is now invited also to step inside the dark.

Two internationally acclaimed  experiences, SÉANCE and FLIGHT, are coming.

event_description:
One of Toronto's oldest holiday traditions. 

First staged here in 1938, this pageant began in St. Martin-in-the-Fields church in London, England in 1928. Queen Elizabeth and her sister Margaret were taken to see it when they were little girls. The story of the Nativity is told through a series of narrated scenes linked by beautiful organ music and carols from an unseen choir.   

Close to 50 volunteers, including babies who take turns playing the role of baby Jesus, perform in the cast. The Church of the Holy Trinity, a 178-year-old architectural treasure, brings its own charm to the show.  ASL interpretation is available on Friday, December 19th.
short_description:
One of Toronto's oldest holiday traditions. 

First staged here in 1938, this pageant began in St. Martin-in-the-Fields

event_description:
A unique storytelling comedy show in downtown Toronto featuring some of the city's most talented storytellers and comedians telling funny stories.

Come check out a different kind of comedy and storytelling show, blending the best of both styles for fun and unique performances by a mix of newcomers and seasoned professionals.

This month's theme, celebrating Halloween, is "Break a Leg", featuring nine funny stories about personal injuries. Not for the squeamish!
event_name: Listen to This! Break a Leg
short_description: A unique storytelling comedy show in downtown Toronto featuring some of the city's most talented storytellers and comedi
short_name: Listen to This! Break a Leg

event_description:
In this new solo work, Laurence Lemieux explores how lineage and the sentiment of belonging has affected her behaviour. 

Anne, is one of Laurence’s ancestors and the starting point of this exploration. The choreographic score draws on these findings, building a structure around individual power and belonging. 

The performance space is designed by senior artist, Edward Poitras, supported by an original composition by Aidan McConnell, lighting design by Nic Vincent, and rehearsal direction by Danielle Baskerville.
short_description: In this new solo work, Laurence Lemieux explores how lineage and the sentiment of belonging has affected her behaviour.

event_description:
Celebrating ten years of hysterical characters and epic monologues, recorded live for the very first time in this comedy special.

Smart, sharp, and full of heart, this night of comedy will include a ballad for the reusable bags that have taken over our homes, a protest against shrinkflation via nine-piece gum packs, an ode to linen, the greatest fabric of all time and much more.
event_name: Gillian Bartolucci’s I Love to Have to Do This
short_description: Celebrating ten years of hysterical characters and epic monologues, recorded live for the very first time in this comedy
short_name: Gillian Bartolucci’s I Love to Have to Do This

event_description:
Since 2009, The Young Novelists have played stages across the U.S. and Canada, released three full-length albums, and won numerous awards and continuous praise for their unmatched, effortless harmonies.

Performing alongside is Merival (Anna Horvath) who is a Toronto-based singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist whose thoughtful, heartache-tinged songs is rooted in relationships and reflection. This has led to her 2016 debut EP "Lovers" and subsequent cross-Canada tours.

event_description:
Support over 30 artists from ace, aro, trans, non-binary and bi communities. Many of the artists are also from disability and/or neurodivergence communities!

Please note masks are required for this event.

We are a community group for folx under the broad asexual, ace and/or aromantic, aro umbrella(s) and for people questioning whether they might be. Please visit our website for more information.
event_name: Toronto Aces and Aros Artisan Market
short_description: Support over 30 artists from ace, aro, trans, non-binary and bi communities. Many of the artists are also from disabilit

event_description:
Curated by Mikinaak Migwans, Earthwork redefines a term that until now has referred to a type of artistic practice associated within the larger conceptual framework of land art. 

In this exhibition, Migwans shifts our understanding of earthwork to refer to a way of working, rather than the making of singular objects, reclaiming the art historical framing from an Indigenous perspective. It considers multiple layers of engagement with the land, including a history of land defense movements, medicine walks, and ancestral practices of prescribed burns, alongside contemporary art.

Featured artists include Michael Belmore, BUSH Gallery (Gabrielle L’Hirondelle Hill, Peter Morin, Tania Willard), Faye HeavyShield, Art Hunter, Alex Jacobs-Blum, Mike MacDonald, Lisa Myers, Edward Poitras, and Protect the Tract Collective.
event_name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto: Earthwork
short_description: Curated by Mikinaak Migwans, Earthwork redefines a term that until now has referred to a type of artistic practice assoc
short_name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto: Earthwork

event_description:
Sharks have intrigued humans for as long as we have explored the oceans. The terrifying monster from the movie Jaws is what many might imagine when they think of these animals, but they are far more fascinating and complex than their depiction in popular culture.

This exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research, and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

event_description:
Making Home in Scarborough is a vibrant pop-up installation celebrating memory, identity, and belonging through cultural traditions and objects we hold dear to our hearts in generations past, present and future. 
 

Co-created through conversation and care, community members were invited to share a meaningful object, rooted in a heartfelt story. All speak to how home is made not only in buildings or borders, but in the places, people, and practices that give life meaning. 
 
As you explore the exhibition, we invite you to reflect: "What does home mean to you?" If you live in Scarborough, "What does Making Home in Scarborough Mean to you?" 
 
We are grateful for our community collaborators: Native Child and Family Services / Scarborough Child & Family Life Centre, Malvern Family Resource Centre, TDSB Newcomer Services (Malvern), Toby's Place, Scarborough Museum Youth Collective and Change Made.
event_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Making Home in Scarborough at Scarborough Museum
short_description: Making Home in Scarborough is a vibrant pop-up installation celebrating memory, identity, and belonging through cultural
short_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Making Home in Scarborough at Scarborough Mu

event_description:
Curated by Mikinaak Migwans, Earthwork redefines a term that until now has referred to a type of artistic practice associated within the larger conceptual framework of land art. 

In this exhibition, Migwans shifts our understanding of earthwork to refer to a way of working, rather than the making of singular objects, reclaiming the art historical framing from an Indigenous perspective. It considers multiple layers of engagement with the land, including a history of land defense movements, medicine walks, and ancestral practices of prescribed burns, alongside contemporary art.

Featured artists include Michael Belmore, BUSH Gallery (Gabrielle L’Hirondelle Hill, Peter Morin, Tania Willard), Faye HeavyShield, Art Hunter, Alex Jacobs-Blum, Mike MacDonald, Lisa Myers, Edward Poitras, and Protect the Tract Collective.
event_name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto: Earthwork
short_description: Curated by Mikinaak Migwans, Earthwork redefines a term that until now has referred to a type of artistic practice assoc

event_description:
Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and perspectives forming a kind of visual and sonic cacophony. It’s a nod to global (or even galactic) unity, and to the idea that despite all the noise and division, we’re more alike than not. 

In her Canadian debut, Intergalactic Planetary brings together imagery and works inspired by cities including Shanghai, Chongqing, Berlin, Tokyo, Bangkok and locations across the United States. Snelling explains, “Through this work, I ask: how can we move beyond our fears, borders, and egos to become more humane? Perhaps by staying curious, open, and willing to see each other more fully, we can take a small step toward connection, and even a glimmer of peace for the future”.

Join us on Nuit Blanche to view the exhibition's works, while DJ beats set the mood with dynamic sounds and enjoy two exhibition-inspired cocktails-one coffee-based and the other with an intergalactic twist.
short_description: Through the use of sculpture, photography, video, and installation, this exhibition is a blend of different people and p

cost_notes: Early bird pricing is available until September 8, 2025. Register early and save using the registration link.
event_description:
Part of our ASPIRE Project (Addressing Barriers to Employment for Muslim Women), this conference aims at fostering equitable and inclusive work environments for Canadian Muslim women. 

The event is a unique learning and sharing experience for Canadian employers, Muslim, racialized women, community-based researchers, employment activists, community settlement workers and policy makers. It includes plenary sessions, concurrent workshops, panel discussions, skills-building and networking opportunities.

Our keynote speakers and expert-led sessions will cover transformative topics including, affirming the case for EDI in the face of backlash, employment and human rights law, inclusive leadership amd much more! Our impressive lineup include: Dr. Wendy Cukier, Muneeza Sheikh, Dr. Zainab Abdurrahman, Dr. Golnaz Golnaraghi and Dr. Rhonda McEwen.
event_name: I Belong, You Belong: CCMW's National Employment Conference
short_description: Part of our ASPIRE Project (Addressing Barriers to Employment for Muslim Women), this conference aims at fostering equit
short_name: I Belong, You Belong: CCMW's National Employment Conference

event_description:
Their journey began in Poland, where they won the prestigious Penderecki Prize at the 1986 National Chamber Music Competition in Łódź. 

Since 1991, they have served as Quartet-in-Residence at Wilfrid Laurier University, helping shape one of Canada’s premier string programs. Known for their dedication to contemporary music, the Penderecki’s have commissioned and performed over 100 new works. 

We invite you to enjoy their program of Krzysztof Penderecki: String Quartet No. 3 Leaves of an Unwritten Diary and Franz Schubert: Quintet in C major for Two Cellos, D. 956.

Arrive early to enjoy a pre-concert performance by Jacques Forestier, violin.
short_description: Their journey began in Poland, where they won the prestigious Penderecki Prize at the 1986 National Chamber Music Compet

event_description:
Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legendary outlaw tale takes on a bold twist - our Robin is a spirited, savvy heroine leading her merry band of misfits in a fight for justice and kindness.  

Join Robin and her friends on a medieval romp through merry old Torontoshire! Journey through the lush forests of High Park, go head-to-head with the greedy Prince John, and rescue those in need - all with a hearty dose of laughter, pop hits, and plenty of surprises. 

Robin Hood delivers all the Panto fun you love, a sparkling spoof on a classic tale, hilarious comedy, dazzling musical numbers, and an intergenerational celebration that's perfect for the whole family.  

Grab your loved ones, don your green tights, and join us for a experience full of mischief, melody, and meaning.
event_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

event_description:
The multi-Grammy Award-winning pianist dazzles as he honours Dizzy Gillespie and Charlie Parker with his band, continuing his father Chico O’Farrill’s legacy of composing and arranging for these jazz icons.

Arturo O’Farrill, pianist, composer, and educator, was born in Mexico and grew up in New York City. His professional career began with the Carla Bley Band and continued as a solo performer with a wide spectrum of artists including Dizzy Gillespie, Lester Bowie, Wynton Marsalis, and Harry Belafonte. 

His powerful piece “Three Revolutions” from the album "Familia: Tribute to Bebo & Chico" won the 2018 Grammy Award for Best Instrumental Composition. Most recently, in February of 2023, Arturo was awarded his eighth Grammy for the album "Fandango at the Wall in New York".

After the concert, enjoy a beverage and more music.
short_description: The multi-Grammy Award-winning pianist dazzles as he honours Dizzy Gillespie and Charlie Parker with his band, continuin

event_description:
A quiet lake in Ontario is making a lot of noise.

Sediments from the bottom of a small lake in Ontario are revealing a remarkable record of our impact on the planet.

Just outside Toronto, Ontario lies Crawford Lake, a significant site offering a unique, comprehensive 1,000-year record of human impacts - local, regional, and global.

It’s a nod to global (or even galactic) unity, and to the idea that despite all the noise and division, we’re more alike than not. 

In her Canadian debut, Intergalactic Planetary brings together imagery and works inspired by cities including Shanghai, Chongqing, Berlin, Tokyo, Bangkok and locations across the United States. Snelling explains, “Through this work, I ask: how can we move beyond our fears, borders, and egos to become more humane? Perhaps by staying curious, open, and willing to see each other more fully, we can take a small step toward connection, and even a glimmer of peace for the future”.

Join us on Nuit Blanche to view the exhibition's works, while DJ beats set the mood with dynamic sounds and enjoy two exhibition-inspired cocktails-one coffee-based and the other with an intergalactic twist.

Tickets must be reserved for all participants, including children. Children under the age of 14 must be accompanied by an adult over the age of 18.
event_description:
Join Scarborough Museum and Aruna Logendrakumar for restorative Chair Yoga sessions! These sessions are family-friendly and appropriate for all experience levels and abilities.

Aruna Logendrakumar is a Scarborough-based yoga practitioner with a passion for accessible movement and wellness. While she has taught mat yoga to participants of all ages, her specialty lies in chair yoga, with a focus on working with seniors. Aruna has trained in yoga at Annamalai University and has also studied Sitha Marma practices, deepening her knowledge of traditional healing techniques and energy points. 

This workshop is part of Scarborough Museum's Season of Celebration - a series of family-friendly activities that celebrate light, love, and joy through food, culture, and storytelling.

event_description:
A quiet lake in Ontario is making a lot of noise.

Sediments from the bottom of a small lake in Ontario are revealing a remarkable record of our impact on the planet.

Just outside Toronto, Ontario lies Crawford Lake, a significant site offering a unique, comprehensive 1,000-year record of human impacts - local, regional, and global.

event_description:
Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legendary outlaw tale takes on a bold twist - our Robin is a spirited, savvy heroine leading her merry band of misfits in a fight for justice and kindness.  

Join Robin and her friends on a medieval romp through merry old Torontoshire! Journey through the lush forests of High Park, go head-to-head with the greedy Prince John, and rescue those in need - all with a hearty dose of laughter, pop hits, and plenty of surprises. 

Robin Hood delivers all the Panto fun you love, a sparkling spoof on a classic tale, hilarious comedy, dazzling musical numbers, and an intergenerational celebration that's perfect for the whole family.  

Grab your loved ones, don your green tights, and join us for a experience full of mischief, melody, and meaning.
event_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

event_description: During this workshop, visitors will create their own Miniature Picture Book produced on the Mackenzie House press. They will experience the art of making a small quarto book (8 pages), along with a discussion concerning the impact of letterpress printing on society. Visitors will also get the opportunity to create their own story using printable images from our collection while learning how to compose type and operate a printing press.  Furthermore, the program will describe the ever-evolving printing industry, and editors such as Mary Ann Shadd Cary and William Lyon Mackenzie.
event_name: Print a Miniature Book on the Mackenzie House Printing Press!
short_description: During this workshop, visitors will create their own Miniature Picture Book produced on the Mackenzie House press. They
short_name: Print a Miniature Book on the Mackenzie House Printing Press

Let the voices of devotion and surrender rise together, from Ibtida to Fanaa, be part of a shared journey of music and mysticism.

Be part of this unforgettable experience!

event_description:
Celebrate the works of acclaimed Irish playwright, Conor McPherson.

The Weir looks in a small rural pub in the West of Ireland, where local lads spin tales of the supernatural, as they vie for the attention of a young woman who recently moved into the area. Little do they know that she has her own personal and compelling story to weave...

Directed by Co-artistic Producer, Rod Ceballos and features Richard Harte (The Boys in the Photograph), Mairi Babb (WAR HORSE), David Mackett (The Good Thief), and Enda Reilly (Toronto Bloomsday Festival).

Celebrate the works of acclaimed Irish playwright, Conor McPherson.

event_description:
Making Home in Scarborough is a vibrant pop-up installation celebrating memory, identity, and belonging through cultural traditions and objects we hold dear to our hearts in generations past, present and future. 
 

Co-created through conversation and care, community members were invited to share a meaningful object, rooted in a heartfelt story. All speak to how home is made not only in buildings or borders, but in the places, people, and practices that give life meaning. 
 
As you explore the exhibition, we invite you to reflect: "What does home mean to you?" If you live in Scarborough, "What does Making Home in Scarborough Mean to you?" 
 
We are grateful for our community collaborators: Native Child and Family Services / Scarborough Child & Family Life Centre, Malvern Family Resource Centre, TDSB Newcomer Services (Malvern), Toby's Place, Scarborough Museum Youth Collective and Change Made.
event_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Making Home in Scarborough at Scarborough Museum
short_description: Making Home in Scarborough is a vibrant pop-up installation celebrating memory, identity, and belonging through cultural
short_name: Pop-Up Exhibit: Making Home in Scarborough at Scarborough Mu

event_description:
This is a solo exhibition by Ukrainian-Canadian artist Olga Polstvin.

Olga is a multidisciplinary artist, cultural leader, and Master of Arts Leadership candidate at Queen’s University whose practice bridges painting, storytelling, and community engagement. Born in Kyiv, Ukraine, she carries forward the resilience and cultural memory of her heritage, weaving themes of belonging, healing, and identity into her work.
event_name: Through the Lens of Ukrainian Belonging

event_description:
Experience a guided sound journey that sparks joy, connection and play through music and movement. Participants will wear headphones and enter a soundscape that blends music, story and guided exploration, inviting you to listen, move and feel together.  

In an era marked by disconnection, loneliness and social division, Reset offers a counter-experience: one rooted in curiosity, shared presence and delight. The work draws on traditions of street theatre, sound art and community ritual to create a space where strangers can become participants, and where every day public space is transformed into a site of collective effervescence.
short_description: Experience a guided sound journey that sparks joy, connection and play through music and movement. Participants will wea

event_description: Introducing “Hidden Toronto” – the new light-hearted walking tour from the creators of The Haunted Walk that’s gonna have you chuckling with laughter and shaking your head in disbelief. Join our crew of storytelling guides as we take you on a 90-minute adventure through the hidden side of Toronto. From movie mistakes to our infamous clown riot, these fun tales of mischief and mayhem make up the fascinating story of our city. Guffaw and gasp through the city’s streets as our fun and engaging tour guides spill the beans on those little-known stories and secrets that define Toronto’s hidden personality. “Hidden Toronto” is a fun and engaging good-natured adventure, perfect for first-time visitors and locals alike.
short_description: Introducing “Hidden Toronto” – the new light-hearted walking tour from the creators of The Haunted Walk that’s gonna hav

event_description:
In the chaos of urban life, we often forget to take a moment to breathe. Take in a moment of stillness, as we inviting visitors to stand beneath something that feels alive.

The outdoor installation, made from a suspended grid of copper leaves, reimagines the shelter of a forest canopy with each leaf individually cut and hung to form a floating canopy above. By day, the leaves catch the light and scatter soft shadows across the ground. By night, lighting transforms the installation, casting intricate patterns on surrounding surfaces and shifting the atmosphere of the space entirely. As wind moves through the piece, the leaves gently sway and rustle, adding a subtle layer of sound to the experience.

Responding to its surroundings and shifting with the light, weather and movement of people passing beneath it, this work offers a dynamic and reflective space in the heart of the city. 

Designed by RAW Works, with Roland Rom Colthoff, Suleman Khan, Elmira Yousefi and Aaron Hendershot.
short_description: In the chaos of urban life, we often forget to take a moment to breathe. Take in a moment of stillness, as we inviting v

event_description:
Late Night laughs. Group Chat Energy. First Saturday Every Month. 'Perfect 10 Comedy' is Comedy Bar’s Saturday monthly late night Stand-Up. Four new handpicked comics every month, bringing their best punchlines, and unfiltered takes. Perfect excuse to bring your crew, hit up that date you were gonna ghost, stay out late, have drinks, and end your night saying “That's crazy.” Hosted by Daniel Woodrow. 
Oct 4th:
Norm Alconcel (Roast Battle Canada)
Lianne Mauladin (ABC's The View)
Jacob Balshin (Just For Laughs/CBC)
James Roque (The Masked Singer NZ)

event_description:
Let the WILD Rumpus Begin!

Hot on the heels of last year’s sold-out sensation, Max and the Wild Things roar back to the YPT stage. Embark on a magical interactive journey as you help transform Max’s bedroom into the legendary land of the Wild Things! Crowned their king, Max faces a big decision: rule the rumpus or return home? Based on Maurice Sendak’s beloved storybook, this adaptation is an interactive experience. 

Audience members will be seated around the performance area on three large mats, with limited chairs provided at the back for grownups who may require a seat.

event_description:
Celebrating art, nature and community.

Featuring over 70 original artworks created outdoors at Toronto Botanical Garden and Edwards Gardens, this curated, site-specific show invites visitors to experience the gardens through the eyes of the artists who paint here, capturing moments of light, movement, and the essence of the natural world.
event_name: Essence of the Garden: Plein Air Art Exhibition and Sale
short_description:
Celebrating art, nature and community.

event_description:
One of the most accomplished violinists of her generation, Lisa Batiashvili performs works by Beethoven, Bartók, Franck, and fellow Georgian Ioseb Bardanashvili, with her compatriot, pianist Giorgi Gigashvili.

Described by The Times as “the complete musician,” Batiashvili commands her place among the world’s foremost artists with performances of great insight and expressive eloquence. The German-based violinist, named Musical America’s 2015 Instrumentalist of the Year and also stands among the winners of Italy’s prestigious International Accademia Musicale Chigiana Prize. 

Born in Tbilisi in 2000, Gigashvili’s musical career took a decisive turn in April 2019 when he won First Prize at the Vigo International Piano Competition.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
event_name: Lisa Batiashvili on Violin, with Giorgi Gigashvili on Piano
short_description: One of the most accomplished violinists of her generation, Lisa Batiashvili performs works by Beethoven, Bartók, Franck,
short_name: Lisa Batiashvili on Violin, with Giorgi Gigashvili on Piano

event_description:
The Bridlewood branch and its neighbourhood are home to a variety of trees. Join City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff to explore the natural world on a local neighbourhood walk. Learn how to recognize different species and fun facts about their cultural and ecological importance.

Children under 12 must be accompanied by a parent/caregiver. Please note that the tour will start and end at the library, and it will be guided by City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff. There may be uneven, unpaved surfaces along the route outside and around the neighbourhood.

Please dress and prepare accordingly for this outdoor program (e.g., hats, sunscreen, water, comfortable shoes). This program takes place rain or shine. In the event of severe inclement weather, please register with the branch to be notified of an alternative date. 

Registration is required. Please contact the branch by phone or in person to register.
event_name: Trees Around the Branch Tour at Bridlewood Library
short_description: The Bridlewood branch and its neighbourhood are home to a variety of trees. Join City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff to
short_name: Trees Around the Branch Tour at Bridlewood Library

event_description:
An immersive audio and visual event. Big sound, big screens. Get excited about hourly door prizes!

A state-of-the-art sound system will blast hits like “Scar Tissue” and “Dani California,” while big screens sync rare live footage, music videos, and psychedelic visuals inspired by the band’s vibrant aesthetic.

Please note this is a tribute event with licensed, pre-recorded music and video. No live performances are scheduled and the band will not be appearing.
event_name: A Toronto tribute to The Red Hot Chili Peppers

event_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reunites to pre-game their twentieth high school reunion, but nostalgia quickly turns into something darker. 

As drinks flow and old wounds resurface, they confront the choices that shaped them, the friendships that endured or crumbled, and the presence of something, or someone they can’t escape. 

Sharp, theatrical, and deeply moving, this is a reckoning for elder millennials, caught between who they were, who they’ve become, and the world they never saw coming. When the night ends, will they still recognize themselves?
short_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reun

event_description:
Every month, we're featuring two celebrated troupes performing polished 30-minute shows for a two night run. Hosted and produced by Taylor Hreljac and Gabe Meacher, this series presents sketch comedy’s best troupes in their best light. 

"We're so excited to be supporting Spotlight at The Second City. Last month, they brought in two sold out audiences to see some hilarious comedy! This new initiative is exactly what the Toronto comedy scene needs: a platform for fresh new sketch comedy to come to life,"  said Susan Waycik, Managing Producer, The Second City Toronto.

This month we're proud to present "$20 Sandwich", featuring Brennan Ashbridge, Tony Hall, Shaun Hunter and Chase Jeffels. They are a sketch troupe known for their viral reels that have amassed 10s of millions of views across TikTok and Instagram. Also presenting the hilarious Sarah Bennett.
short_description: Every month, we're featuring two celebrated troupes performing polished 30-minute shows for a two night run. Hosted and

event_description:
Discover Hyunsun Park's captivating collection of gouache paintings that evoke empathy and connection. Each painting is a window into personal and shared experiences-- stories of survival, resilience, and the search for meaning.

Join the Artists for the opening reception on Saturday, August 9, 2 to 4 p.m. Light refreshments provided.
event_name: Stars, Scars Etched in Blue Art Exhibition

event_description:
Beginning July 1st at Scarborough Museum, experience Washed Up by Hatecopy. The project captures the essence of liminal spaces that serve as cultural hubs for the South Asian immigrant communities, using the washing machine as a vessel to carry textiles that signify our roots and drawing visitors into an environment that intertwines the past, present, and future; acknowledging the dirty laundry of Canadian History and “Truth,” and reclaiming both seen and unseen spaces.

Maria Qamar (b. 1991) is a Toronto-based pop artist whose work is focused in the South Asian diaspora and immigrant communities and their cultural experiences. The work specializes in themes regarding feminism, social change, humour, pop culture, politics and romance. The artist has been recognized both nationally and internationally with exhibits and features in the Museum of Contemporary Arts, the National Arts Centre, Sotheby’s, Phillips Auction, and the AGO.
event_name: Washed Up: Pop-Up Installation at Scarborough Museum
short_description: Beginning July 1st at Scarborough Museum, experience Washed Up by Hatecopy. The project captures the essence of liminal
short_name: Washed Up: Pop-Up Installation at Scarborough Museum

event_description:
Sharks have intrigued humans for as long as we have explored the oceans. The terrifying monster from the movie Jaws is what many might imagine when they think of these animals, but they are far more fascinating and complex than their depiction in popular culture.

This exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research, and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

event_description: Join Paws for Parks for a tail-wagging good time as we stroll through High Park’s ravines learning about this unique ecosystem and how we and our furry friends can protect nature. This dog-friendly adventure is the ulti-mutt way to responsibly enjoy Toronto’s largest park. Advance registration is required.
event_name: K9 Ravine Ramble with Paws for Parks in High Park
short_description: Join Paws for Parks for a tail-wagging good time as we stroll through High Park’s ravines learning about this unique eco

event_description:
Experience the deep emotions of Portuguese fado with Carminho, one of the leading figures of the genre in her generation. Daughter of the legendary fadista Teresa Siqueira, few artists have modernized fado as much as she has, combining reverence for the traditions of fado with a modern vision all her own. 

Her debut made waves in Portugal and worldwide, going platinum at home and earning rave reviews internationally. In Brazil, it opened doors to collaborations with legends like Milton Nascimento, Chico Buarque, and Nana Caymmi. 

Carminho has recently received attention for her appearance in Yorgos Lanthimos’s Oscar-winning film Poor Things, where she captivates Emma Stone’s character and the audience, bringing a fresh, modern twist to fado through her performance. More recently, she shared the stage with Coldplay and had the honour of performing for Pope Francis during World Youth Day in Lisbon.
short_description: Experience the deep emotions of Portuguese fado with Carminho, one of the leading figures of the genre in her generation

event_description:
Expect a wonderfully varied program as Music Director Nurhan Arman leads the ensemble and two virtuoso guest artists in the orchestra’s first concert of 2026. 

A cheerful Mozart Divertimento will open for the new Fantasia ‘Conjure You’ by Toronto composer/producer David Jaeger. The brilliant Quebec cellist Noémie Raymond will play one of the best-loved works for her instrument, the Saint-Saëns Cello Concerto No. 1. Berlin Philharmonic oboist Cristoph Hartmann will appear in two beautiful works, a new concerto by Toronto composer Norbert Palej and JS Bach’s Oboe Concerto in D minor.
short_description: Expect a wonderfully varied program as Music Director Nurhan Arman leads the ensemble and two virtuoso guest artists in

event_description:
"I Am Scarborough" is a community-engaged installation at Scarborough Museum, created by artist Kseniya Tsoy during her Toronto Arts Council Animating Historic Sites residency.

Over the course of several months, Scarborough residents and museum visitors came together to fold hundreds of origami butterflies and share their stories—their journeys, the lands their families come from, and their hopes and dreams.

Now gathered and suspended in flight, these butterflies embody the vibrant diversity of Scarborough—soaring high and envisioning a bright, shared future.

Experience their collective flight at Scarborough Museum through October 2025.
event_name: I am Scarborough - Installation at Scarborough Museum
short_description: "I Am Scarborough" is a community-engaged installation at Scarborough Museum, created by artist Kseniya Tsoy during her
short_name: I am Scarborough - Installation at Scarborough Museum

event_description:
One of the UK’s most exciting new comedians—is heading to Canada with his smash-hit show!

Described by The Telegraph as “a joke machine,” Jake Lambert’s non-stop gag-filled storytelling has made him one of the fastest-rising names in comedy. The Sunshine Kid sees Jake hilariously navigate the quirks of everyday life, his fear of being “normal,” and the all-too-familiar urge to ask strangers what breed their dogs are. Jake’s spot-on, viral online videos have amassed more than 500 million views and earned him over 650,000 Instagram followers. He has supported comedy superstar Michael McIntyre on his worldwide tour and appeared on Live At The Apollo, Comedy Central, and Dave.

As a writer, Jake has contributed to many of the UK’s top comedy shows, including The Royal Variety Performance, Michael McIntyre's Big Show, Bake Off, and 8 Out of 10 Cats. His 2022 Edinburgh Fringe show Liminal was one of the best-reviewed shows of the festival.
event_name: Jake Lambert's The Sunshine Kid Tour
short_description:
One of the UK’s most exciting new comedians—is heading to Canada with his smash-hit show!

Described by The Telegraph as
short_name: Jake Lambert's The Sunshine Kid Tour

event_description:
Renowned Canadian songwriter Stephen Fearing is poised to once again captivate listeners with the release of his next album, "The Empathist". 

The 10-track record, produced in collaboration with Grammy-nominated drummer Ken Coomer (Wilco, Uncle
Tupelo), showcases Fearing’s ability to blend heartfelt storytelling with rich, immersive soundscapes. Recorded in Nashville over a whirlwind week, "The Empathist" features contributions from long time Blackie & The Rodeo Kings bassist John Dymond and Nashville multi-instrumentalist Jim Hoke, whose mastery of pedal steel, piano, and saxophone adds depth and texture to the album.

Fans can expect an emotionally charged live experience that highlights the creative risks and bold musicalinterplay that have defined Fearing’s career.
short_description: Renowned Canadian songwriter Stephen Fearing is poised to once again captivate listeners with the release of his next al

event_description:
Celebrating 30 years since the release of his acclaimed debut "The Hiss of Distance", Toronto's very own returns to the stage with songs and stories from the album that launched his solo career plus the six albums that followed, including 2024’s "Forelsket". 

A milestone evening with one of Canada’s most gifted acoustic musicians, still here, still making music, and still carving his own path with heart and honesty.
short_description: Celebrating 30 years since the release of his acclaimed debut "The Hiss of Distance", Toronto's very own returns to the

event_description:
As night falls, we’ll set out on a lantern-lit stroll along the cobblestone streets of the historic Distillery District, one of Toronto’s most haunted spots! 

Learn about the tragic events that left their mark and hear spine-chilling tales of paranormal encounters from this iconic area. Feel the goosebumps rise as you explore the narrow alleyways and hidden corners where spirits are said to lurk. 

Whether you’re a history buff, a ghost enthusiast, or just looking for a unique experience, this outdoor tour is sure to captivate your imagination. Get ready to experience the thrills and chills like never before.
event_name: Spirits of the Distillery District Ghost Tour
short_description: As night falls, we’ll set out on a lantern-lit stroll along the cobblestone streets of the historic Distillery District,
short_name: Spirits of the Distillery District Ghost Tour

event_description:
Picture this: towering 45 feet high by 200 feet wide screens wrapping around you, cutting-edge sound and projection technology and the electrifying live performance of Gunslingers bringing the music of Guns N’ Roses to life like never before.

This isn’t just a concert, it’s a full-throttle tribute experience that will put you right in the heart of the music you love.

Food and drinks will be available. Sing, shout, and rock out with us!
event_name: Gunslingers: an Immersive Tribute to Guns N' Roses
short_description: Picture this: towering 45 feet high by 200 feet wide screens wrapping around you, cutting-edge sound and projection tech
short_name: Gunslingers: an Immersive Tribute to Guns N' Roses

event_description:
The must-see event of the Halloween season is back! From the creators of the sold-out sensation, Tales of the Grotesque (2023 - 2024), comes a new anthology of gothic horror. Experience what critics call a “devilish delight!” With fresh characters, familiar tales, and unique terrors, we bring literature’s most depraved characters to life… and death.

After a lady of the night is murdered, a mad doctor strikes a pact with the Devil to raise her from the dead. But when he comes face-to-face with her killer at a masquerade, all hell breaks loose. Descend into madness with Victor Frankenstein, Henry Jekyll, and Dorian Gray as they discover the consequences of playing God and the monstrous repercussions when the Devil comes to collect. 

An immersive horror opera set within the oldest surviving building from the Town of York, we invite you to explore Victorian Toronto through the eyes of history’s most disturbed authors, though it might just cost your soul.
short_description: The must-see event of the Halloween season is back! From the creators of the sold-out sensation, Tales of the Grotesque

event_description:
Late Night laughs. Group Chat Energy. First Saturday Every Month. 'Perfect 10 Comedy' is Comedy Bar’s Saturday monthly late night Stand-Up. Four new handpicked comics every month, bringing their best punchlines, and unfiltered takes. Perfect excuse to bring your crew, hit up that date you were gonna ghost, stay out late, have drinks, and end your night saying “That's crazy.” Hosted by Daniel Woodrow. 
Oct 4th:
Norm Alconcel (Roast Battle Canada)
Lianne Mauladin (ABC's The View)
Jacob Balshin (Just For Laughs/CBC)
James Roque (The Masked Singer NZ)
event_name: Late Night Stand Up - Comedy Bar

short_name: Late Night Stand Up - Comedy Bar

event_description:
Join our community event in honour of the thousands of Chinese Railroad Workers who came to Canada in the late 1800s to help build the Canadian Pacific Railway. 

The event will include speeches by community leaders and dignitaries, traditional lion dance by the Northern Legs and Southern Fists Kung Fu Club, and music by the Ontario Chinese Seniors Association Choir and Orchestra.
event_name: Annual Wreath Laying Ceremony in Honour of the Chinese Railroad Workers of Canada
short_description: Join our community event in honour of the thousands of Chinese Railroad Workers who came to Canada in the late 1800s to
short_name: Annual Wreath Laying Ceremony in Honour of the Chinese Railr

event_description:
An epic, music-charged bromance.

Two years after selling out its Canadian premiere, King Gilgamesh (and the Man of the Wild) returns. This moving, funny, and raucous Dora-winning production weaves together a modern Toronto bromance with the world’s oldest epic.
 
Created and performed by Ahmed Moneka and Jesse LaVercombe alongside Ahmed's 2025-Juno-nominated Arabic jazz band and directed by acclaimed New York and Chicago-based director Seth Bockley, this show has sold out runs and received critical praise in Minneapolis, Halifax, Chicago and New York.
event_name: King Gilgamesh (and the Man of the Wild)
short_description:
An epic, music-charged bromance.

short_name: King Gilgamesh (and the Man of the Wild)

cost_notes: Soulpepper Theatre offers a Free 25 & Under program. See website for details.
event_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reunites to pre-game their twentieth high school reunion, but nostalgia quickly turns into something darker. 

As drinks flow and old wounds resurface, they confront the choices that shaped them, the friendships that endured or crumbled, and the presence of something, or someone they can’t escape. 

Sharp, theatrical, and deeply moving, this is a reckoning for elder millennials, caught between who they were, who they’ve become, and the world they never saw coming. When the night ends, will they still recognize themselves?
short_description:
The past never really stays in the past.

event_description: Experience the soulful sounds of live jazz in the heart of Toronto’s Vibrant Junction neighbourhood.  Step into the past and stay for the magic.  It’s magical intimate setting,  offers the perfect blend of dinner, handcrafted cocktails, and smooth rhythms. Whether you’re here to unwind, connect, or be inspired, it’s more than a night out—it’s a vibe. Join us weekly for music, magic, and memorable moments.

cost_notes: All participants must be 16 or older.
event_description: Join us for a spine-chilling paranormal adventure where intimate groups of 12 or fewer will have exclusive access to investigate haunted heritage buildings – including the notorious Half Way House – in the dark! Feel the chill of the night and listen to the whispers of the past as we employ ancient and modern techniques to attempt to establish contact with the lingering spirits that call the Village home. ‘Alone in the Dark’ is as real as it gets, nothing is hidden or staged. This unforgettably eerie evening will delight ghost story enthusiasts, fearless paranormal investigators, history aficionados, urban explorers, and anyone with a curiosity about the unknown. Book your spot now—spaces fill fast! All participants must be 16 or older.
event_name: Alone in the Dark – The Village at Black Creek
short_description: Join us for a spine-chilling paranormal adventure where intimate groups of 12 or fewer will have exclusive access to inv
short_name: Alone in the Dark – The Village at Black Creek

event_description:
Sharks have intrigued humans for as long as we have explored the oceans. The terrifying monster from the movie Jaws is what many might imagine when they think of these animals, but they are far more fascinating and complex than their depiction in popular culture.

This exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research, and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

event_description:
Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legendary outlaw tale takes on a bold twist - our Robin is a spirited, savvy heroine leading her merry band of misfits in a fight for justice and kindness.  

Join Robin and her friends on a medieval romp through merry old Torontoshire! Journey through the lush forests of High Park, go head-to-head with the greedy Prince John, and rescue those in need - all with a hearty dose of laughter, pop hits, and plenty of surprises. 

Robin Hood delivers all the Panto fun you love, a sparkling spoof on a classic tale, hilarious comedy, dazzling musical numbers, and an intergenerational celebration that's perfect for the whole family.  

Grab your loved ones, don your green tights, and join us for a experience full of mischief, melody, and meaning.
event_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

short_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

cost_notes:
Tickets are $18 + HST and are non-refundable but transferable.
Purchase advance tickets online using the City of Toronto's program registrations software. If you do not already have an account, you will need to create one. 
If you have trouble registering, please contact clodge@toronto.ca or call 416-392-6916.
event_description:
Join us for a chilling tour at Colborne Lodge in High Park. 

Visit the gravesite of John and Jemima Howard. Explore ideas about death and the afterlife from the 1800s and hear true tales of paranormal activities. Experience some of the museum’s dark stories if you dare! 

A portion of this event is outside so please dress accordingly. 
Recommended for ages 12 and up. Youth 12-16 must be accompanied by an adult.
event_name: After Dark Tours: The Unexplained at Colborne Lodge
short_description:
Join us for a chilling tour at Colborne Lodge in High Park. 

Visit the gravesite of John and Jemima Howard. Explore id
short_name: After Dark Tours: The Unexplained at Colborne Lodge

cost_notes: Tickets are non-refundable but can be transferred to another guest.
event_description: During this workshop, visitors will create their own Miniature Picture Book produced on the Mackenzie House press. They will experience the art of making a small quarto book (8 pages), along with a discussion concerning the impact of letterpress printing on society. Visitors will also get the opportunity to create their own story using printable images from our collection while learning how to compose type and operate a printing press.  Furthermore, the program will describe the ever-evolving printing industry, and editors such as Mary Ann Shadd Cary and William Lyon Mackenzie.
event_name: Print a Miniature Book on the Mackenzie House Printing Press!
short_description: During this workshop, visitors will create their own Miniature Picture Book produced on the Mackenzie House press. They
short_name: Print a Miniature Book on the Mackenzie House Printing Press

event_description:
Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.
event_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition
short_description: Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagi
short_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

short_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

event_description:
Toronto’s Favourite Holiday Panto Returns!

Get ready to root for the underdog and boo the baddies! This year, the legendary outlaw tale takes on a bold twist - our Robin is a spirited, savvy heroine leading her merry band of misfits in a fight for justice and kindness.  

Join Robin and her friends on a medieval romp through merry old Torontoshire! Journey through the lush forests of High Park, go head-to-head with the greedy Prince John, and rescue those in need - all with a hearty dose of laughter, pop hits, and plenty of surprises. 

Robin Hood delivers all the Panto fun you love, a sparkling spoof on a classic tale, hilarious comedy, dazzling musical numbers, and an intergenerational celebration that's perfect for the whole family.  

Grab your loved ones, don your green tights, and join us for a experience full of mischief, melody, and meaning.
event_name: Robin Hood: A Very Merry Family Musical

event_description:
The Southern Netherlands, better known today as Flanders, was home to revolutionary artists. 

These extraordinary painters found new ways to depict reality, portray humanity, and tell stories that created parallels to their world then and to our world today. This large-scale exhibition, featuring over 80 stunning art works and objects, medieval, renaissance, baroque paintings, sculptures and more, offering a doorway to art between 1400 to 1700. 

The exhibition's unique presentation introduces the visitor, through these rare, extraordinary artworks, to stories of enterprising townspeople, prosperous cities, and an ever-developing society.
event_name: Saints, Sinners, Lovers and Fools: 300 Years of Flemish Masterworks

event_description:
Experience our world in vivid detail and see some of the most unusual species and their habitats in ways you never imagined. 

Each back-lit photograph provides exquisite quality and depth. From the photographer's eye to the camera's lens, viewers become witnesses to the lives animals live and the challenges they face. 

Emotive, surprising, and sometimes sobering, glimpses of life on our planet are showcased through exceptional talent, technical expertise, and perfectly captured moments.
event_name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year Exhibition

event_description:
Sharks have intrigued humans for as long as we have explored the oceans. The terrifying monster from the movie Jaws is what many might imagine when they think of these animals, but they are far more fascinating and complex than their depiction in popular culture.

This exhibition invites you to uncover fresh perspectives, groundbreaking research, and the astounding diversity of this ancient group of fishes.

Visitors will delve into the anatomy, behaviour, and history of sharks, from familiar favourites like tiger sharks and great whites to lesser-known species like the dwarf lanternshark—a tiny, light-producing marvel small enough to hold in your hand.

event_description: Experience the soulful sounds of live jazz in the heart of Toronto’s Vibrant Junction neighbourhood.  Step into the past and stay for the magic.  It’s magical intimate setting,  offers the perfect blend of dinner, handcrafted cocktails, and smooth rhythms. Whether you’re here to unwind, connect, or be inspired, it’s more than a night out—it’s a vibe. Join us weekly for music, magic, and memorable moments.

cost_notes: Ticket includes admission into the museum. If you are a ROM Member, please contact for discount options.
event_description:
Back by popular demand!

There has been a mysterious murder, and the museum's collections hold the key.  As you gather clues, you’ll begin to piece together a tale of greed, lust, pride, and revenge. Working in teams, sleuths travel through the museum's galleries solving whodunnit, where, and with what. Will your team solve the mystery before the clock runs out?

Please note for participation, at least one player per team must bring a phone with our scavenger hunt app downloaded for submitting answers and creative team photos and videos during the adventure, but the more the merrier!
event_name: Intrigue at the Museum: A Mystery Scavenger Hunt

cost_notes: Soulpepper Theatre offers a Free 25 & Under program. See website for details.
event_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reunites to pre-game their twentieth high school reunion, but nostalgia quickly turns into something darker. 

As drinks flow and old wounds resurface, they confront the choices that shaped them, the friendships that endured or crumbled, and the presence of something, or someone they can’t escape. 

Sharp, theatrical, and deeply moving, this is a reckoning for elder millennials, caught between who they were, who they’ve become, and the world they never saw coming. When the night ends, will they still recognize themselves?
short_description:
The past never really stays in the past.  

A group of old classmates self-declared the “Multi-Ethnic Reject Group” reun

cost_notes: Please see website for details on ticket pricing.
event_description:
Opening our 2025-2026 season with a program tracing a dramatic arc from struggle to transcendence. 

Christine Donkin’s Three Autumn Scenes sets the stage with vivid, evocative imagery. 

Beethoven’s Leonore Overture No. 3, written for his only opera Fidelio, captures the emotional tension and ultimate triumph of freedom over oppression. 

Prokofiev’s Violin Concerto No. 1, performed by acclaimed Canadian violinist and our concertmaster Corey Gemmell, offers a striking contrast—dreamlike, lyrical, and unexpectedly delicate in its early 20th-century modernism. 

Strauss’s Tod und Verklärung (Death and Transfiguration) concludes the program, a sweeping tone poem that follows an artist’s final journey from mortality to metaphysical release.
event_name: Into the Light: Prokofiev, Beethoven, R. Strauss
short_description:

event_description:
Toronto’s all-night celebration of contemporary art returns! 

Throughout the spectacle,  401 will be teaming with dynamic and interactive exhibitions, installations and performances. Two floors of creative exploration offer a unique experience highlighting a diversity of cultural practice and showcasing the iconic address that continues to transform Toronto’s cultural landscape.

event_description:
Offering a festive bouquet of well-loved melodies to celebrate the season! With music from the 18th to 21st centuries, from the famous Overture and Pifa from Handel’s Messiah up to Canadian composer Larry Strachan’s evocative ‘Lament for Souls of Sauteurs’ written in 2008. 

The Ezra Duo - violinist Jacob Clewell and pianist Sasha Bult-Ito - will be featured in Mendelssohn’s charming Double Concerto in D minor, and Maestro Arman will also lead the orchestra in Vivaldi’s Sinfonia L’incoronazione di Dario and Jenkins’ famous “diamond music” Palladio.
short_description: Offering a festive bouquet of well-loved melodies to celebrate the season! With music from the 18th to 21st centuries, f

event_description:
Enjoy the performances of two stellar flutists performing two beautiful double concertos, a Baroque favourite by Vivaldi, and the world premiere of a picturesque work by prominent Canadian composer Alice Ping Yee Ho. 

The new work’s title, “Three Birds: Celestial Concerto for Two Flutes and Strings” reflects inspiration for its three movements from three traditions: Italy, China and the Indigenous Peoples of Canada. The concertos will feature an international collaboration of virtuosos, Toronto flutist Susan Hoeppner and Italian flutist Luisa Sello. Under the baton of Music Director Nurhan Arman, the orchestra will also play Vivaldi’s Sinfonia in G, Glazounov’s romantic-Russian Theme and Variations, and the beautifully folk-inspired Suite by Janacek.
short_description: Enjoy the performances of two stellar flutists performing two beautiful double concertos, a Baroque favourite by Vivaldi

event_description:
Photography comes alive! 

Professional dancers, musicians and poets interpret the work of nine different photographers. View the awesome synergy created in these performances, known as Ekphrasis!  

Exhibit is open for viewing by appointment, please contact.
short_description:
Photography comes alive!

event_description:
Celebrating our 40th anniversary with the return of Mozart’s enchanting fairy tale!

One of the most popular productions in our repetoire and sung in Andrew Porter’s acclaimed English translation, The Magic Flute is a dazzling blend of comedy and fantasy, in which dragons and spirits roam, and perseverance is rewarded by true love. This is the tale of a prince, Tamino, who is sent by the Queen of the Night to rescue her daughter Pamina from her nemesis Sarastro.
short_description:
Celebrating our 40th anniversary with the return of Mozart’s enchanting fairy tale!
